question.title: Will New York implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, New York has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local New York newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will New York establish a tuition-free community college program by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by July 31, 2024, New York has officially established a tuition-free community college program. Confirmation of implementation occurs when students can enroll in community colleges without paying tuition fees, as reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets (including local New York publications, national news organizations, or official announcements from the state government). The program must be part of a comprehensive state initiative, rather than being confined to particular institutions or experimental programs. If such implementation does not take place by the resolution date, or if it is only partially or limitedly executed, the inquiry will be answered negatively.

question.title: Conditional on New York implementing a free community college plan by July 2024, will the US maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made EVs through August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: New York implements a free community college plan by July 31, 2024. This means that by this date, New York has officially implemented a state-wide initiative allowing students to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, confirmed by at least two reputable news sources. The plan must not be limited to specific institutions or pilot programs.

Then, is it true that the United States will maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles through August 31, 2024? This resolves as YES if the US continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles as of this date, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or removed by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If New York enacts a tuition-free community college initiative by July 2024, will the United States uphold a 100% tariff on electric vehicles manufactured in China until August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: New York enacts a tuition-free community college initiative by July 31, 2024. This indicates that by this date, New York has officially launched a state-wide program permitting students to attend community colleges without paying tuition fees, as confirmed by at least two credible news outlets. The initiative must not be restricted to certain institutions or experimental programs.

Then, is it accurate that the United States will uphold a 100% tariff on electric vehicles produced in China until August 31, 2024? This would be answered with YES if the US continues to enforce a 100% tariff on imports of electric vehicles made in China as of this date, which must be verifiable through official U.S. government channels and supported by at least two reliable news organizations. If the tariff is lowered below 100% or eliminated by August 31, 2024, the response would be NO.

question.title: Conditional on New York implementing free community college and the US maintaining a 100% tariff on Chinese EVs, will Mexico's Senate pass a major economic reform opposed by López Obrador?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both (a) New York implements a free community college plan by July 2024, allowing students to enroll without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources, and (b) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles through August 2024, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. Then, will Mexico's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President López Obrador by August 2024?

To resolve as YES, by August 31, 2024, Mexico's Senate must pass a major economic reform bill related to fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, explicitly opposed by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador or his administration, as reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' in terms of its potential impact on the Mexican economy, regardless of whether it becomes law.

para_P.title: If New York goes ahead with free community college and the US keeps a 100% tariff on Chinese electric vehicles, will Mexico's Senate approve a significant economic reform that López Obrador is against?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: (a) New York rolls out a free community college initiative by July 2024, permitting students to register without tuition costs, as confirmed by at least two credible news outlets, and (b) The United States upholds a 100% tariff on electric vehicles manufactured in China until August 2024, verifiable through official U.S. government documentation and supported by at least two trustworthy news organizations. Then, will Mexico's Senate endorse a substantial economic reform legislation that President López Obrador opposes by August 2024?

For a YES outcome, by August 31, 2024, Mexico's Senate must approve a significant economic reform measure concerning fiscal policy, taxation, or monetary strategy, which is explicitly opposed by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador or his administration, as reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' regarding its potential influence on the Mexican economy, irrespective of its enactment.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) New York implements a free community college plan by July 2024, (2) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electric vehicles through August 2024, and (3) Mexico's Senate passes a major economic reform bill opposed by President López Obrador by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES only if all of the following conditions are met:

1. New York has officially implemented a free community college plan by July 31, 2024, allowing students to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources. The plan must be a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs.

2. The United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made electric vehicles as of August 31, 2024, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations.

3. By August 31, 2024, Mexico's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador or his administration. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President López Obrador or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Mexican economy.

If any of these conditions are not met, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following will take place: (1) New York enacts a no-cost community college initiative by July 2024, (2) The United States retains a full 100% tariff on electric vehicles manufactured in China until August 2024, and (3) Mexico's Senate approves a significant economic reform legislation that is opposed by President López Obrador by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES only if all of the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. New York has formally enacted a no-cost community college initiative by July 31, 2024, enabling students to register in community colleges without tuition costs, as confirmed by at least two credible news outlets. The initiative must be a statewide program, not confined to particular institutions or experimental schemes.

2. The United States continues to enforce a full 100% tariff on the importation of electric vehicles produced in China as of August 31, 2024, verifiable through official U.S. governmental sources and supported by at least two trusted news organizations.

3. By August 31, 2024, Mexico's Senate passes a significant economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Andrés Manuel López Obrador or his administration. The bill must pertain to economic policy, such as fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary policy. It must be approved by the Senate, irrespective of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President López Obrador or his administration must be distinctly reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be labeled as 'significant' or 'major' by these news outlets in terms of its potential effect on the Mexican economy.

If any of these criteria are unmet, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Spain's IBEX 35 index reach or exceed 10,000 points by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points. The 10,000 point level is chosen as a representative value that the index might have been at before a significant drop. Verification will be based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index does not reach 10,000 points during this period, the question resolves as NO. Note that intraday highs count for resolution; the index does not need to close at or above 10,000 points.

para_P.title: Will the IBEX 35 index of Spain hit or surpass 10,000 points by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, at any time from October 1, 2023 to August 31, 2024, the IBEX 35 index of Spain hits or surpasses the 10,000 point mark. The 10,000 point threshold is selected as a significant level that the index may have previously reached before a major decline. Confirmation will be derived from official index reports issued by trusted financial market data sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. If the index fails to reach 10,000 points during this timeframe, the answer will be NO. It is important to note that intraday peaks are considered for resolution; the index does not have to close at or above 10,000 points.

question.title: If Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points by August 2024, will the Bank of Korea announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points at any moment between October 1, 2023, and August 31, 2024. Verification is based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid, and intraday highs count.

Then, is it true that the Bank of Korea will publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, and there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction.

para_P.title: Should Spain's IBEX 35 index hit or surpass 10,000 points by August 2024, will the Bank of Korea make a public statement regarding a decrease in its key interest rate by that same month?
para_P.body:
Assume the following holds true: Spain's IBEX 35 index either hits or exceeds 10,000 points at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024. Confirmation will rely on official index reports from credible financial market data sources like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid, with intraday peaks included.

In that case, is it accurate to say that the Bank of Korea will officially declare a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? This declaration must be made publicly by the Bank of Korea and covered by at least two trustworthy financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must pertain to the base rate, and there should be a definitive announcement regarding an actual decrease in the rate.

question.title: Given that both Spain's IBEX 35 reaches 10,000 and the Bank of Korea cuts rates, will Sam Bankman-Fried face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following events both occur by August 31, 2024: (a) Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points, verified by official index reports from sources like Bloomberg or Reuters, with intraday highs counting, and (b) The Bank of Korea announces a reduction in its key interest rate, confirmed by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg or CNBC. Given these conditions, will Sam Bankman-Fried face new bankruptcy proceedings by July 31, 2024? This resolves as YES if new bankruptcy proceedings against Sam Bankman-Fried are initiated by July 31, 2024, confirmed by official court records or reported by at least two major news outlets. The proceedings must be new and unrelated to previous cases. If no such proceedings are initiated, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If Spain's IBEX 35 hits 10,000 and the Bank of Korea lowers interest rates, will Sam Bankman-Fried encounter fresh bankruptcy filings by July 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Spain's IBEX 35 index achieves or surpasses 10,000 points, as confirmed by official index reports from sources such as Bloomberg or Reuters, including intraday peaks, and (b) The Bank of Korea declares a decrease in its primary interest rate, verified by at least two credible financial news outlets like Bloomberg or CNBC. Under these circumstances, will Sam Bankman-Fried face new bankruptcy filings by July 31, 2024? This will be considered a YES if new bankruptcy actions against Sam Bankman-Fried are launched by July 31, 2024, as validated by official court documents or reported by at least two prominent news organizations. The bankruptcy actions must be new and not connected to prior cases. If no such actions are taken, it will be a NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points and the Bank of Korea announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, and (2) Sam Bankman-Fried faces new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Spain's IBEX 35 index reaches or exceeds 10,000 points at any point between October 1, 2023 and August 31, 2024, with verification based on official index reports from reputable financial market data providers such as Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. Intraday highs count for resolution. Additionally, the Bank of Korea must publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024, with the announcement officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. (2) By July 31, 2024, new bankruptcy proceedings must be initiated against Sam Bankman-Fried, confirmed by official court records or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). The proceedings must be separate from and unrelated to any previous bankruptcy cases. If all these events occur by the specified dates, the question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it true that the following events will take place: (1) Spain's IBEX 35 index hits or surpasses 10,000 points and the Bank of Korea makes a public announcement of a key interest rate cut by August 2024, and (2) Sam Bankman-Fried is subject to new bankruptcy proceedings by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if both of the following criteria are satisfied: (1) Spain's IBEX 35 index must reach or exceed 10,000 points at any time from October 1, 2023, to August 31, 2024, with confirmation based on official index data from trusted financial market information providers like Bloomberg, Reuters, or the Bolsa de Madrid. Intraday peaks are included for resolution. Furthermore, the Bank of Korea needs to publicly declare a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024, with the announcement made by the Bank of Korea and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. (2) By July 31, 2024, new bankruptcy proceedings against Sam Bankman-Fried must be initiated, verified by official court documentation or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal, or CNN). These proceedings must be distinct from and not related to any prior bankruptcy cases. If all these conditions are fulfilled by the specified dates, the answer will be YES; if not, it will be NO.

question.title: Will the Indian government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant Indian agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

para_P.title: Will the Indian government restart the evaluation of liquefied natural gas export initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially restarted the evaluation of initiatives focused on exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The restart must be validated through official government communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The restart should involve the active processing or examination of LNG export project proposals by the relevant Indian authorities. If no such restart occurs by the resolution date, or if the halt on evaluation continues, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. It is important to note that this question does not necessitate the approval of any specific initiatives, only the resumption of the evaluation process.

question.title: Given the Indian government resumes consideration of LNG export projects by July 2024, will Ukraine become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially resumed consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG), confirmed through official announcements or reports from reputable sources, involving the active processing or review of LNG export project applications. Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Ukraine is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance, with confirmation through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or its member countries and reported by reputable international news sources, including Ukraine as a full member?

para_P.title: If the Indian government restarts the evaluation of LNG export initiatives by July 2024, will Ukraine be accepted into the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds: By July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially restarted the evaluation of initiatives for exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG), as confirmed by official statements or reports from credible sources, which include the active processing or assessment of LNG export project applications. Then, is it accurate that by August 31, 2024, Ukraine is officially recognized as a member of the BRICS alliance, with confirmation through official statements from the BRICS alliance or its member nations and reported by credible international news outlets, including Ukraine as a full member?

question.title: Conditional on both India resuming LNG export project considerations and Ukraine joining BRICS, will U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG), confirmed through official announcements or reports from at least two reputable sources, and involving active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant Indian agencies. (b) By August 31, 2024, Ukraine is formally accepted as a full member of the BRICS alliance, confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or its member countries and reported by at least two reputable international news sources. Given these conditions, will the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024?

para_P.title: If both India restarts its LNG export project considerations and Ukraine becomes a BRICS member, will U.S. weekly jobless claims surpass 275,000 for four straight weeks by August 2024?
para_P.body: Assume the following holds true: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially resumed evaluating projects related to liquefied natural gas (LNG) exports, confirmed through official announcements or reports from at least two credible sources, and involves active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant Indian authorities. (b) By August 31, 2024, Ukraine is officially recognized as a full member of the BRICS coalition, confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS coalition or its member nations and reported by at least two reputable international media outlets. Under these circumstances, will the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any time before August 31, 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) the Indian government resume consideration of liquefied natural gas export projects by July 2024, (b) Ukraine become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024, and (c) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at exporting liquefied natural gas (LNG). The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant Indian agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process. (b) By August 31, 2024, Ukraine is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include Ukraine as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if Ukraine's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO. (c) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

para_P.title: Is it true that all of the following will take place: (a) by July 2024, the Indian government will have restarted the assessment of liquefied natural gas export initiatives, (b) Ukraine will join the BRICS coalition by August 2024, and (c) the U.S. will report weekly jobless claims surpassing 275,000 for four straight weeks by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if all of these criteria are fulfilled: (a) By July 31, 2024, the Indian government has officially recommenced the evaluation of projects related to liquefied natural gas (LNG) exports. This resumption must be validated by official government statements or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of LNG export project applications by relevant Indian authorities. If no such resumption is observed by the resolution date, or if the halt on consideration continues, the answer will be NO. Note that this question does not necessitate the endorsement of any specific projects, only the restart of the evaluation process. (b) By August 31, 2024, Ukraine is officially recognized as a member of the BRICS coalition. For a positive resolution, this recognition must be confirmed through official declarations from the BRICS alliance or any of its member nations (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable global news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal recognition must include Ukraine as a full member, not merely as an observer or associate member. If no such recognition occurs by the resolution date, or if Ukraine's membership remains pending or under review, the answer will be NO. (c) The count of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any time between now and August 31, 2024. The question will be resolved as NO if this condition is not satisfied within the designated timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official statistics released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Will Meta lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Meta has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Meta confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

para_P.title: Is it true that Meta will terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Meta has officially acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must be derived from formal company announcements, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be clearly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan revealed in 2023. If Meta verifies a lesser number of layoffs, or if no confirmation that meets these conditions is provided by the resolution date, the answer will be NO. Partial layoffs or staggered implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee count by the resolution date will also lead to a NO outcome.

question.title: Given Meta lays off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia announce an interest rate change by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Meta confirms the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If these criteria are met, then will the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia officially announce an interest rate change by August 31, 2024? The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Saudi Arabia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia, and be reported by at least two major financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, or Financial Times.

para_P.title: If Meta confirms the layoff of no fewer than 1,800 employees by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia declare a change in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, Meta verifies the termination of at least 1,800 positions as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. This verification must originate from official company announcements, regulatory documents, or reports by a minimum of two credible news organizations such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. The layoffs need to be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan introduced in 2023. If these conditions are satisfied, will the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia formally declare an alteration in interest rates by August 31, 2024? This declaration must be communicated through an official channel of the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank, and must be covered by at least two prominent financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, or Financial Times.

question.title: Given both Meta lays off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024 and the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia announces an interest rate change by August 2024, will the FDA issue a recall for ground tarragon products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (1) By July 31, 2024, Meta has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, with confirmation from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources, explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia officially announces an interest rate change, with the announcement coming from an official Central Bank communication channel and reported by at least two major financial news outlets.

Given these conditions, will the FDA issue a recall for any ground tarragon products due to lead contamination by July 31, 2024? The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations. A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If Meta reduces its workforce by a minimum of 1,800 employees by July 2024 and the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia makes an announcement about changing interest rates by August 2024, will the FDA call for a recall of ground tarragon products because of lead contamination by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: (1) By July 31, 2024, Meta has officially confirmed the layoff of no fewer than 1,800 employees as part of its reorganization plan focused on AI, with verification from official company statements, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news organizations, directly associated with the AI-centered restructuring announced in 2023. (2) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia publicly discloses a change in interest rates, with the announcement made via an official communication channel from the Central Bank and reported by at least two leading financial news sources.

Under these circumstances, will the FDA issue a recall for any ground tarragon products due to lead contamination by July 31, 2024? The recall must be validated through official announcements from the FDA or reports from at least two major news outlets. A recall is characterized as a formal request from the FDA for manufacturers to withdraw their products from the marketplace. Alerts or warnings without a formal recall do not count as a YES answer.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) both of the following occur: (a) Meta lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024 and (b) the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia announce an interest rate change by August 2024, and (2) the FDA issue a recall for ground tarragon products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body:
(1) This condition will resolve as YES if both of the following sub-conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Meta has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Meta confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the sub-condition resolves as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia officially announces an interest rate change. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Saudi Arabia communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia. The announcement should explicitly state the change in interest rates. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia maintains the current interest rates, the sub-condition resolves as NO.

(2) This condition resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground tarragon products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the condition resolves as NO.

For this combined question to resolve as YES, both conditions (1) and (2) must be satisfied as described above. If either condition is not met, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it certain that the following will take place: (1) both of these events happen: (a) by July 2024, Meta will have let go of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-centered restructuring, and (b) by August 2024, the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia will declare a modification in interest rates, and (2) the FDA will issue a recall for ground tarragon products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) This condition will be deemed YES if both of these sub-conditions are fulfilled: (a) By July 31, 2024, Meta must have officially confirmed the termination of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-oriented reorganization strategy. This confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports from at least two credible news sources (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Meta verifies a smaller number of layoffs, or if there is no confirmation that meets these standards by the resolution date, this sub-condition will resolve as NO. (b) By August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia must officially announce a change in interest rates. This announcement should come from an official communication channel of the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia, such as a press release or a public address by the Governor of the Central Bank. The announcement must clearly state the alteration in interest rates and be reported by at least two major financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement occurs by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia keeps the existing interest rates, this sub-condition will resolve as NO.

(2) This condition will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) formally issues a recall for any ground tarragon products due to lead contamination. This recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as an official request by the FDA for manufacturers to withdraw their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, this condition will resolve as NO.

For this combined question to be answered YES, both conditions (1) and (2) must be met as described above. If either condition fails to be satisfied, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

question.title: Will Mexican authorities officially declare the dismantling of the Jalisco New Generation drug cartel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Mexican authorities (such as federal law enforcement agencies or high-ranking government officials) make an official public declaration stating that the Jalisco New Generation drug cartel has been dismantled or effectively neutralized as a criminal organization. The declaration must be reported by at least two reputable international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN, or major Mexican news sources). The declaration should indicate a significant disruption to the cartel's leadership structure, operations, or ability to function as a cohesive criminal entity. Mere arrests of individual members or partial disruptions to the cartel's activities do not qualify for a YES resolution. question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate by July 31, 2024. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of South Korea members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.
