question.title: Given Pennsylvania implements a free community college plan by July 2024, will South Dakota hold a referendum on education reform by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Pennsylvania has officially implemented a free community college plan, allowing students to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as confirmed by at least two reputable news sources. This must be a state-wide initiative and not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. 

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, South Dakota will officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of education reform? For this to be true, the referendum must involve significant changes in the state education system or policies, be officially announced by the South Dakota state government, and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources. Simply scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify.

para_P.title: If Pennsylvania enacts a tuition-free community college initiative by July 2024, will South Dakota conduct a statewide vote on educational reform by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: By July 31, 2024, Pennsylvania has successfully put into place a tuition-free community college initiative, enabling students to attend community colleges without any fees, as verified by no less than two credible news outlets. This must be a comprehensive state initiative, not confined to particular schools or trial programs. 

Then, can it be affirmed that by July 31, 2024, South Dakota will carry out an official statewide vote concerning education reform? For this to be accurate, the vote must pertain to substantial modifications in the state’s educational framework or policies, be formally declared by the South Dakota state authorities, and the voting process must be finalized by the specified date. The event and its outcomes must be reported by at least two prominent, trustworthy news organizations. Merely planning a referendum for a future date beyond the specified resolution does not satisfy this condition.

question.title: Given both Pennsylvania implements a free community college plan and South Dakota holds a referendum on education reform by July 2024, will Washington implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional relationship between the educational reforms in Pennsylvania and South Dakota and the potential implementation of a free community college plan in Washington.

Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024:
(a) Pennsylvania has officially implemented a free community college plan, confirmed by student enrollment without tuition fees across the state, as reported by at least two reputable news sources.
(b) South Dakota has conducted a statewide referendum on education reform, officially announced and completed, with coverage by at least two major news sources.

Given these conditions, will Washington also implement a free community college plan by the same date? For Washington's plan, it must be confirmed that students can enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources, and it must be a state-wide initiative.

If the conditions in Pennsylvania and South Dakota are not both met, this question resolves as N/A. Otherwise, it resolves YES if Washington implements the plan as described, and NO if it does not.

para_P.title: If Pennsylvania adopts a free community college initiative and South Dakota conducts a vote on educational reform by July 2024, will Washington also adopt a free community college initiative by that same date?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines the conditional link between the educational initiatives in Pennsylvania and South Dakota and the possible adoption of a free community college initiative in Washington.

Assuming the following holds true by July 31, 2024:
(a) Pennsylvania has officially adopted a free community college initiative, verified by student enrollment without tuition fees across the state, as reported by at least two credible news outlets.
(b) South Dakota has carried out a statewide vote on educational reform, officially announced and completed, with coverage by at least two major news outlets.

Under these circumstances, will Washington also adopt a free community college initiative by the same deadline? For Washington's initiative, it must be confirmed that students can enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two credible news outlets, and it must be a statewide program.

If the conditions in Pennsylvania and South Dakota are not both fulfilled, this question resolves as N/A. Otherwise, it resolves YES if Washington adopts the initiative as described, and NO if it does not.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) Pennsylvania implement a free community college plan, (b) South Dakota hold a referendum on education reform, and (c) Washington implement a free community college plan?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by July 31, 2024: (a) Pennsylvania has officially implemented a free community college plan, confirmed if students can enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources. The plan must be state-wide, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. (b) South Dakota has conducted a statewide referendum on education reform, officially announced by the state government, with the voting process completed and reported by at least two major, reputable news sources. (c) Washington has officially implemented a free community college plan, confirmed if students can enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources. The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If any of these conditions are not met by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following happen: (a) Pennsylvania introduce a no-cost community college initiative, (b) South Dakota conduct a vote on educational reform, and (c) Washington launch a no-cost community college initiative?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if all of the subsequent conditions are fulfilled by July 31, 2024: (a) Pennsylvania has officially introduced a no-cost community college initiative, confirmed if students can enroll in community colleges without paying tuition fees, as reported by at least two credible news outlets. The initiative must be statewide, not confined to particular institutions or pilot programs. (b) South Dakota has carried out a statewide vote on educational reform, officially declared by the state government, with the voting process completed and reported by at least two major, credible news outlets. (c) Washington has officially introduced a no-cost community college initiative, confirmed if students can enroll in community colleges without paying tuition fees, as reported by at least two credible news outlets. The initiative must be part of a statewide program, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If any of these conditions are not satisfied by the resolution date, the inquiry will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its Doritos brand by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Doritos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Doritos in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will PepsiCo have announced a rise in North American demand for its Doritos brand?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates an uptick in North American demand for its Doritos brand in comparison to the demand noted in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo, and corroborated by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The rise in demand should be explicitly mentioned or clearly suggested in the company’s financial disclosures or official announcements. If no such increase is reported by the designated date, or if PepsiCo indicates a continued drop or stagnation in demand for Doritos in North America, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Conditional on increased North American demand for Doritos, will a nasal spray for cholesterol management be FDA-approved and available in U.S. pharmacies by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Doritos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. This increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications.

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, a nasal spray approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for managing cholesterol is available for purchase in at least one major U.S. pharmacy chain (such as CVS, Walgreens, or Rite Aid)? The availability must be confirmed through official announcements by the manufacturer, the pharmacy chains, or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The nasal spray must be specifically approved for cholesterol management. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If there is a rise in demand for Doritos in North America, will a cholesterol management nasal spray be approved by the FDA and sold in U.S. pharmacies by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates an increase in the demand for its Doritos product in North America compared to the figures from the second quarter of 2023. This increase must be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The rise in demand should be clearly stated or strongly suggested in the company's financial disclosures or official communications.

Then, is it accurate that by August 31, 2024, a nasal spray that has received approval from the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for cholesterol management is available for sale in at least one major pharmacy chain in the U.S. (like CVS, Walgreens, or Rite Aid)? The availability must be verified through official statements from the manufacturer, the pharmacy chains, or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The nasal spray must specifically be approved for the purpose of managing cholesterol. If such availability is not confirmed by the resolution date, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Given PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for Doritos and a cholesterol nasal spray is FDA-approved, will a major healthcare company relocate to Austin by July 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Doritos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023, confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources. Additionally, by August 31, 2024, a nasal spray approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for managing cholesterol is available for purchase in at least one major U.S. pharmacy chain. Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, a major healthcare company will have fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas? For this to resolve as YES, the relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership and reported by at least two major, reputable news sources, with the new headquarters operational in Austin, Texas, and key executive functions transferred.

para_P.title: With PepsiCo indicating a rise in North American interest for Doritos and a cholesterol nasal spray receiving FDA approval, will a prominent healthcare firm shift its headquarters to Austin by July 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates a rise in North American interest for its Doritos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023, verified through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and covered by at least two credible news outlets. Furthermore, by August 31, 2024, a nasal spray sanctioned by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for cholesterol management is obtainable at a minimum of one major U.S. pharmacy chain. Then, can it be confirmed that by July 31, 2024, a significant healthcare firm will have completely moved its headquarters from its previous location to Austin, Texas? For this to be confirmed as YES, the relocation must be officially declared by the firm or its executives and reported by at least two major, credible news outlets, with the new headquarters operational in Austin, Texas, and essential executive functions transferred.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) PepsiCo reports increased North American demand for its Doritos brand by July 2024, (b) a nasal spray for cholesterol management is FDA-approved and available in U.S. pharmacies by August 2024, AND (c) the headquarters of a major healthcare company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES only if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its Doritos brand compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for Doritos in North America, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, a nasal spray approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for managing cholesterol is available for purchase in at least one major U.S. pharmacy chain (such as CVS, Walgreens, or Rite Aid). The availability must be confirmed through official announcements by the manufacturer, the pharmacy chains, or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The nasal spray must be specifically approved for cholesterol management. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO.

(c) By July 31, 2024, a major healthcare company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, this part will resolve as NO.

The final resolution of this combined question is YES only if all conditions (a), (b), and (c) are satisfied within their respective timeframes.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events will happen: (a) PepsiCo announces a rise in North American demand for its Doritos brand by July 2024, (b) a nasal spray for cholesterol control receives FDA approval and is sold in U.S. pharmacies by August 2024, AND (c) a significant healthcare firm's headquarters is completely moved to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES only if all of the following conditions are fulfilled:

(a) By July 31, 2024, PepsiCo announces an increase in North American demand for its Doritos brand compared to the demand recorded in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be validated through official earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly mentioned or clearly implied in the company's financial statements or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo indicates a continued decline or stagnation in demand for Doritos in North America, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, a nasal spray sanctioned by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for cholesterol management is available for sale in at least one major U.S. pharmacy chain (like CVS, Walgreens, or Rite Aid). The availability must be confirmed through official announcements from the manufacturer, the pharmacy chains, or reports from at least two reliable news sources. The nasal spray must be specifically authorized for cholesterol management. If no such availability is confirmed by the resolution date, this part will resolve as NO.

(c) By July 31, 2024, a prominent healthcare company has entirely shifted its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially declared by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be adequate for a YES resolution. If the relocation is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company opts against the move, this part will resolve as NO.

The ultimate resolution of this combined question is YES only if all conditions (a), (b), and (c) are fulfilled within their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will Union Pacific reach a new agreement with the train engineers' union addressing safety protocols by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses safety protocols for engineers. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of safety protocols for train engineers, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address safety protocols, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will a new contract concerning safety measures be established between Union Pacific and the train engineers' union by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union that represents train engineers make a public declaration of a new contract that explicitly covers safety measures for engineers. The contract must receive official confirmation from both Union Pacific and the union, and be reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The contract should specifically tackle the matter of safety measures for train engineers, as highlighted in the ongoing conflict. If such a contract is not established, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced contract fails to specifically address safety measures, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Conditional on Union Pacific reaching a new agreement with the train engineers' union addressing safety protocols by August 2024, will Brazil add at least 200,000 jobs in any single month between October 2023 and July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses safety protocols for engineers. This agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of safety protocols for train engineers, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute.

Given this condition, will Brazil record a monthly increase of at least 200,000 jobs in any single month from October 2023 through July 2024, as confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly Labour Market Report? The data must be from the initial reported figures for each month, with no consideration for revisions to previously reported data.

para_P.title: If Union Pacific successfully negotiates a new deal with the train engineers' union regarding safety measures by August 2024, will Brazil experience a rise of at least 200,000 jobs in any month from October 2023 to July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By the end of August 2024, Union Pacific and the train engineers' union make a public declaration of a new agreement that specifically focuses on safety measures for engineers. This agreement must receive official validation from both Union Pacific and the union, and be covered by a minimum of two prominent news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or leading national newspapers). The agreement should specifically tackle the safety measures concerning train engineers, as highlighted in the ongoing negotiations.

Under this premise, will Brazil document a monthly job growth of no less than 200,000 in any month between October 2023 and July 2024, as verified by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly Labour Market Report? The figures must be based on the initially reported statistics for each month, without accounting for any revisions to earlier reported data.

question.title: Given both Union Pacific reaches a new safety protocol agreement with engineers and Brazil adds 200,000 jobs in a month, will Union Pacific reach a new work schedule agreement with conductors?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) By August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses safety protocols for engineers. This agreement is officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets. The agreement directly addresses safety protocols for train engineers. (b) In any month from October 2023 through July 2024, Brazil records a monthly increase of at least 200,000 jobs in an official jobs report, confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics.

Then, will the following be true: By August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. This agreement is officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets. The agreement directly addresses making schedules more predictable for train conductors.

para_P.title: If Union Pacific establishes a fresh safety protocol agreement with engineers and Brazil creates 200,000 jobs in a month, will Union Pacific finalize a new work schedule agreement with conductors?
para_P.body:
Assume the following conditions hold: (a) By August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly declare a new agreement that specifically pertains to safety protocols for engineers. This agreement is officially verified by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news organizations. The agreement directly concerns safety protocols for train engineers. (b) During any month from October 2023 through July 2024, Brazil reports a monthly increase of no less than 200,000 jobs in an official jobs report, corroborated by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics.

Then, will it be the case that by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses the predictability of work schedules for conductors? This agreement is officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets. The agreement directly focuses on enhancing the predictability of schedules for train conductors.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific reaches a new agreement with the train engineers' union addressing safety protocols, (b) Brazil adds at least 200,000 jobs in any single month between October 2023 and July 2024, and (c) Union Pacific reaches a new agreement with the conductors' union addressing work schedule predictability?
question.body: (a) This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses safety protocols for engineers. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of safety protocols for train engineers, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address safety protocols, the question will resolve as NO. (b) This question resolves as YES if, in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, Brazil records a monthly increase of at least 200,000 jobs in an official jobs report. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly Labour Market Report. If no such monthly increase is reported within this period, the question resolves as NO. Revisions to previously reported data will not be considered for resolution; only the initial reported figures for each month will be used. (c) This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly announce a new agreement that specifically addresses work schedule predictability for conductors. The agreement must be officially confirmed by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The agreement should directly address the issue of making schedules more predictable for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such agreement is reached, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced agreement does not specifically address work schedule predictability, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will all of these events take place by August 2024: (a) Union Pacific finalizes a new contract with the engineers' union concerning safety measures, (b) Brazil creates a minimum of 200,000 jobs in any month from October 2023 to July 2024, and (c) Union Pacific establishes a new deal with the conductors' union regarding schedule reliability?
para_P.body: (a) This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train engineers publicly declare a new contract that explicitly addresses safety measures for engineers. The contract must be officially acknowledged by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The contract should directly tackle the matter of safety measures for train engineers, as noted in the ongoing dispute. If no such contract is finalized, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced contract does not specifically address safety measures, the inquiry will be answered as NO. (b) This inquiry resolves as YES if, in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, Brazil reports a monthly increase of no less than 200,000 jobs in an official employment report. The figures must be validated by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly Labour Market Report. If no such monthly increase is documented during this timeframe, the inquiry resolves as NO. Revisions to previously reported figures will not be taken into account for resolution; only the initially reported data for each month will be utilized. (c) This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by August 31, 2024, Union Pacific and the union representing train conductors publicly declare a new contract that explicitly addresses schedule reliability for conductors. The contract must be officially acknowledged by both Union Pacific and the union, and reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, or major national newspapers). The contract should directly tackle the issue of enhancing schedule reliability for train conductors, as mentioned in the ongoing dispute. If no such contract is finalized, announced, and reported by the resolution date, or if an announced contract does not specifically address schedule reliability, the inquiry will be answered as NO.

question.title: Will Oxfam announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Oxfam officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Oxfam channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Oxfam reveal new funding pledges exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered TRUE if, by July 31, 2024, Oxfam publicly discloses one or more new funding pledges that together surpass $400 million. The disclosure(s) must occur through official Oxfam channels (like their website or press releases) and be covered by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges must represent new initiatives or significant expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously announced commitments. If no such disclosure is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry resolves as FALSE.

question.title: Given Oxfam announces over $400 million in new funding commitments by July 2024, will the UN announce additional vehicles converted to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Oxfam officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million by July 31, 2024. The announcement(s) must be made through official Oxfam channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Then, will the United Nations officially announce, by July 31, 2024, that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel? The announcement must come from official UN channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the UN fleet or directly associated with UN transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If Oxfam reveals more than $400 million in new funding commitments by July 2024, will the UN declare that more vehicles have been converted to biofuel by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Oxfam makes an official declaration of one or more new funding commitments that amount to over $400 million by July 31, 2024. These announcements must be made through official Oxfam platforms (such as their website or press releases) and must be covered by at least two credible news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must pertain to new projects or substantial expansions of current initiatives, not just continuations of previously stated commitments.

In that case, will the United Nations make an official statement by July 31, 2024, indicating that additional vehicles, beyond those already acknowledged, have been converted or are being converted to operate on biofuel? This announcement must originate from official UN communications or be reported by at least two prominent, reliable news agencies (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The newly converted vehicles must belong to the UN fleet or be directly linked to UN transportation. If no such statement is issued by the specified deadline, the question will be answered with a NO.

question.title: Conditional on Oxfam securing over $400 million in new funding and the UN converting additional vehicles to biofuel, will Arizona receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) Oxfam officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official Oxfam channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. (b) The United Nations officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official UN channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the UN fleet or directly associated with UN transportation. 

Given these conditions, will Arizona receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024? This will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of Arizona is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within Arizona. If the total amount of such grants awarded to Arizona does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If Oxfam obtains more than $400 million in fresh funding and the UN transitions more vehicles to biofuel, will Arizona get over $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle initiatives by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true by July 31, 2024: (a) Oxfam makes an official declaration of one or more new funding pledges that total more than $400 million. These announcements must be made through Oxfam's official channels (like their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two credible news organizations (for instance, Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding must represent new projects or substantial expansions of existing programs, not just ongoing commitments. (b) The United Nations publicly states that additional vehicles, beyond those already acknowledged, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to biofuel. This announcement must come from official UN channels or be covered by at least two prominent, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The newly converted vehicles must be part of the UN fleet or directly related to UN transportation. 

Under these conditions, will Arizona receive over $300 million in federal funding for electric vehicle projects by July 2024? This will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is confirmed that Arizona has been granted more than $300 million in federal funds specifically for electric vehicle production, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must be from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or reported by at least two major national news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). question.title: Will the Bank of Korea announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?

The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. question.title: Given the Bank of Korea announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, will the German economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Bank of Korea publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of Korea and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the base rate, which is the Bank of Korea's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction.

Then, is it true that the German economy will avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question resolves as NO if the German economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

A mere suggestion or conjecture about potential rate cuts does not suffice; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual reduction.

In that case, is it accurate to say that the German economy will evade a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as recorded by the Federal Statistical Office of Germany. The question will be answered as NO if the German economy encounters two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the DAX Index lose over €3 trillion in value by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) report that the total value lost by the DAX Index has exceeded €3 trillion since October 1, 2023. The loss in value should be calculated from the index's peak value prior to October 1, 2023. If the total value lost remains at or below €3 trillion by the resolution date, or if there are no clear reports confirming such a loss, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, the value lost refers to the decrease in the combined market capitalization of the companies comprising the DAX Index.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the DAX Index will drop more than €3 trillion in value by August 2024?

question.title: Conditional on the DAX Index losing over €3 trillion in value by August 2024, will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the potential impact of a significant loss in value of the DAX Index on the Canadian economy. 

Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, reputable financial news sources report that the total value lost by the DAX Index has exceeded €3 trillion since October 1, 2023. The loss in value is calculated from the index's peak value prior to October 1, 2023, and refers to the decrease in the combined market capitalization of the companies comprising the DAX Index. 

Then, will the Canadian economy avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The question resolves as YES if the Canadian economy does not enter a recession by July 31, 2024, and NO if it does experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: If the DAX Index experiences a decline exceeding €3 trillion in value by August 2024, can the Canadian economy escape a recession by July 2024?

This loss is measured from the index's highest value before October 1, 2023, and pertains to the reduction in the overall market capitalization of the firms that make up the DAX Index. 

Under these circumstances, will the Canadian economy manage to avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the context of this question, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. The answer will be YES if the Canadian economy does not fall into a recession by July 31, 2024, and NO if it does face two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Given the DAX Index loses over €3 trillion by August 2024 and Canada avoids recession by July 2024, will WHO declare the dengue outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, reputable financial news sources report that the total value lost by the DAX Index has exceeded €3 trillion since October 1, 2023, calculated from the index's peak value prior to October 1, 2023. Additionally, by July 31, 2024, the Canadian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Canada. Given these conditions, will the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declare the ongoing dengue outbreak over by August 31, 2024? The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources. The outbreak referred to is the one that prompted heightened global public health responses. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the DAX Index sees a decline exceeding €3 trillion by August 2024, and Canada manages to sidestep a recession by July 2024, will the World Health Organization announce the end of the dengue outbreak by August 2024?

The outbreak in question is the one that led to increased global public health measures. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the WHO prolongs the emergency status past August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be reports indicating that TikTok's AI-generated content is responsible for disseminating misinformation regarding elections?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, there exist credible accounts or official alerts from election officials, government entities, or trusted news organizations asserting that TikTok's AI-generated content is responsible for spreading misinformation about elections. For this inquiry, 'election misinformation' is defined as inaccurate or deceptive information concerning electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Credible accounts should originate from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US television networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The accounts or alerts must explicitly reference TikTok's AI and its involvement in the dissemination of election misinformation. If no such accounts or alerts are provided by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude with a NO.

question.title: Conditional on TikTok's AI spreading election misinformation, will Ohio enact stricter abortion regulations by July 2024?
question.body:
This question examines the potential correlation between two events:

Condition: By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. 'Election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation.

Outcome: By July 31, 2024, Ohio enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the outcome resolves as NO.

If the condition is not met, the outcome resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If TikTok's AI disseminates false information regarding elections, will Ohio implement more stringent abortion laws by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry explores the possible link between two occurrences:

Condition: By August 31, 2024, there are trustworthy reports or official alerts from electoral officials, governmental bodies, or credible news organizations indicating that TikTok's AI-generated content suggestions are propagating false information about elections. 'False information about elections' refers to inaccurate or misleading details concerning election procedures, candidates, or results. Trustworthy reports should originate from at least two sources: state or federal electoral officials, prominent news organizations (such as the Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The reports or alerts must specifically reference TikTok's AI and its involvement in the dissemination of election-related falsehoods.

Outcome: By July 31, 2024, Ohio enacts new statutes or regulations that impose more rigorous standards on abortion service providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be validated by official state legislative records or covered by at least two reputable news outlets. More rigorous standards may entail additional licensing, reporting, or facility requirements specifically for abortion service providers. If no such statutes or regulations are put in place, or if any statutes or regulations enacted are applicable uniformly to all healthcare providers, the outcome resolves as NO.

If the condition is not satisfied, the outcome resolves as N/A.

question.title: If both TikTok spreads election misinformation and Ohio enacts stricter abortion regulations, will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. (b) By July 31, 2024, Ohio enacts new laws or regulations imposing stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers, confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources.

Then, will Arizona hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 31, 2024? For Arizona to hold a referendum, the following must occur: 1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Arizona state government. 2. It must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection. 3. The results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. The question resolves as NO if no such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024, or if it is cancelled, postponed, or does not focus on enshrining abortion rights protection.

The referendum must be formally announced and carried out by the Arizona state government. 2. It must specifically tackle the issue of abortion rights protection. 3. The results must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or widely acknowledged news organizations. The question is answered as NO if no such referendum takes place by August 31, 2024, or if it is cancelled, postponed, or does not concentrate on the protection of abortion rights.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following three events take place: (a) Reports emerge indicating that TikTok's AI content recommendations are contributing to the dissemination of election-related misinformation, (b) Stricter abortion laws are implemented in Ohio, and (c) A public vote on abortion rights is held in Arizona?

The reports or alerts must specifically reference TikTok's AI and its involvement in the propagation of election-related misinformation.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Ohio implements new laws or regulations that establish more stringent requirements for abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The implementation must be validated by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two credible news outlets. Stricter requirements may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards unique to abortion providers.

(c) By August 31, 2024, Arizona officially carries out a public referendum aimed specifically at securing protections for abortion rights within the state. The referendum must be formally announced and executed by the Arizona state government, explicitly addressing the matter of abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly disclosed by official state channels or well-regarded news organizations.

If any of these criteria are not fulfilled by their respective resolution dates, the inquiry will be deemed FALSE.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the mpox outbreak in Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the mpox outbreak in Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the mpox outbreak in Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the African mpox outbreak, not a global mpox situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about mpox that does not specifically address the African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the African mpox outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the African mpox outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

The inquiry will result in a NO if:
1. The WHO fails to issue such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding mpox that does not specifically mention the outbreak in Africa.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency designation of the mpox outbreak in Africa.

Note: If the WHO has already stated that the African mpox outbreak is no longer a global emergency before the start date of this question, the outcome will still be determined based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following occur: (1) The Central Bank of Malaysia publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Central Bank of Malaysia and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the overnight policy rate, which is the Central Bank of Malaysia's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. (2) Apple officially announces specific measures aimed at reducing electricity consumption attributed to its AI operations by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be made through official company channels (such as press releases, blog posts, or annual reports) or reported by at least two major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The measures announced should be concrete steps or initiatives designed to decrease the energy usage of Apple's AI systems. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced measures do not specifically target AI-related electricity consumption, the question resolves as NO. (3) The Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) officially declares the ongoing mpox outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official CDC announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the CDC to issue public health warnings. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the CDC extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. If all these conditions are met, the combined question resolves as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Moderna allow generic production of its mRNA technology by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Moderna officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its mRNA technology, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). question.title: Given Moderna allows generic production of its mRNA technology by July 2024, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made medical equipment through August 2024?
question.body:

This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production, confirmed by official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources.

The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. question.title: If Moderna allows generic mRNA production and the US maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese medical equipment, will Argentina avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Moderna officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its mRNA technology, effectively not enforcing its patent, and (b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made medical equipment. Both conditions must be verified through official announcements and corroborated by reputable news sources.

Given these conditions, will the Argentine economy avoid a recession by July 31, 2024? For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Censuses of Argentina. The question resolves as YES if Argentina does not experience such a recession within the specified period, and NO if it does.

para_P.title: If Moderna permits the production of generic mRNA and the US continues to enforce a 100% tariff on medical equipment from China, will Argentina evade a recession by July 2024?

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) Moderna allow generic production of its mRNA technology by July 2024, (b) the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made medical equipment through August 2024, and (c) the Argentine economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES only if all of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, Moderna officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its mRNA technology, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Moderna continues to enforce its patent rights, this part resolves as NO. (b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made medical equipment. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this part will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question. (c) By July 31, 2024, the Argentine economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the National Institute of Statistics and Censuses of Argentina. The question resolves as NO if the Argentine economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. The combined question resolves as YES only if (a), (b), and (c) all resolve as YES.

question.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) both Colorado and New Jersey hold referendums on abortion rights by July 2024, and (2) the struck-down part of Colorado's 2023 election law be reinstated by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur:

(1) By August 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:
   - The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Colorado state government.
   - The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
   - The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.
   - The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024, a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date, or a referendum is held but does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.
   - Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

(2) By July 31, 2024, New Jersey officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the New Jersey state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New Jersey-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New Jersey and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

AND

(3) By July 31, 2024, the part of Colorado's 2023 election law that was struck down by a federal judge (specifically, the restrictions on voters with disabilities casting absentee ballots) is reinstated through legal or legislative action. The reinstatement must be confirmed through official legal documents or announcements and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If no such reinstatement occurs by the resolution date, or if the law remains partially or fully struck down, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question pertains only to the specific part of the law related to restrictions on voters with disabilities and absentee ballots, not the entire 2023 election law.

The question will resolve as NO if any of the above conditions are not met.
