para_P.title: Will the number of weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 300,000 for three straight weeks before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as documented by the U.S. Department of Labor, go beyond 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. It will be marked as NO if this scenario does not occur within the stated period. For the purpose of resolution, only official statistics published by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

question.title: Conditional on U.S. weekly jobless claims exceeding 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024, will New Jersey conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor. Then, will New Jersey conduct a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Official data from the U.S. Department of Labor must confirm that weekly initial jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 31, 2024.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: New Jersey must conduct a public referendum focused on abortion rights protection by August 31, 2024, meeting the following criteria:
1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If U.S. weekly jobless claims surpass 300,000 for three straight weeks by August 2024, will a referendum on abortion rights take place in New Jersey by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: At any time before August 31, 2024, the weekly initial jobless claims in the United States are reported to exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks by the U.S. Department of Labor. Will New Jersey hold a public vote aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024?

Criteria for determining the condition: Official statistics from the U.S. Department of Labor must verify that weekly initial jobless claims have gone beyond 300,000 for three continuous weeks by August 31, 2024.

Criteria for determining the outcome: New Jersey is required to carry out a public vote concerning the protection of abortion rights by August 31, 2024, which must satisfy the following conditions:
1. The vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of New Jersey.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The results of the vote must be disclosed through official state communication or recognized news outlets. If such a vote does not take place by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given both high U.S. jobless claims and a New Jersey abortion referendum by August 2024, will President Biden speak at a California NEA event by July 2024?
question.body:
This question explores the conditional scenario where both of the following occur by August 31, 2024: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks, and (b) New Jersey conducts a referendum on abortion rights. 

Suppose the following is true: 
1. The U.S. Department of Labor reports that weekly initial jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024.
2. New Jersey officially announces and conducts a public referendum focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights, with the results reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

Then, given these conditions, will President Joe Biden deliver a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in California by July 31, 2024? The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If no such speech occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If both U.S. jobless claims remain high and New Jersey holds an abortion referendum by August 2024, will President Biden address a California NEA event by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry examines a hypothetical situation where the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims surpass 300,000 for three consecutive weeks, and (b) New Jersey carries out a referendum regarding abortion rights. 

Assuming these statements hold true: 
1. The U.S. Department of Labor indicates that weekly initial jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024.
2. New Jersey officially declares and conducts a public referendum aimed at securing abortion rights, with the outcomes reported by official state channels or widely recognized news outlets.

Then, under these circumstances, will President Joe Biden give a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event occurring in California by July 31, 2024? The speech must be verified by official announcements from the White House or reports from at least two credible news organizations. If no such speech takes place by the resolution date, the answer is NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks, (b) New Jersey conducts a referendum on abortion rights, and (c) President Biden delivers a speech at a National Education Association event in California?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

1. The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered.

2. New Jersey conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of New Jersey, the primary focus must be on abortion rights protection, and the results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

3. By July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden delivers a speech at any National Education Association (NEA) event held in California. The speech must be confirmed by official White House announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources.

If any of the above conditions are not met by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following events take place: (a) U.S. weekly unemployment claims surpass 300,000 for three straight weeks, (b) New Jersey holds a vote on abortion rights, and (c) President Biden gives a talk at a National Education Association event in California?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if all the subsequent criteria are satisfied:

1. The weekly initial unemployment claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceed 300,000 for three consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024. Only the official statistics released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account.

2. New Jersey organizes a public vote specifically aimed at establishing protections for abortion rights within the state. For a YES outcome, the vote must be officially declared and executed by the state of New Jersey, the primary emphasis must be on safeguarding abortion rights, and the results must be made public through official state communications or widely acknowledged news outlets.

3. By July 31, 2024, President Joe Biden addresses any National Education Association (NEA) gathering occurring in California. The address must be verified by official announcements from the White House or reports from at least two credible news organizations.

If any of the aforementioned conditions are not fulfilled by their respective deadlines, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will NASA announce a new type of simulated Mars environment focused on robotic exploration by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, NASA officially announces the development or initiation of a new type of simulated Mars environment focused on robotic exploration that is distinct from any previously disclosed projects. The announcement must come from official NASA channels or be reported by at least three major news organizations. The new environment must be explicitly described as a separate project or initiative from existing simulations. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced project is merely an extension or modification of an existing simulation, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will NASA reveal a novel simulated environment for Mars that emphasizes robotic exploration?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be determined as YES if, by July 31, 2024, NASA makes an official declaration regarding the creation or commencement of a new type of simulated environment for Mars that centers on robotic exploration and is different from any previously mentioned projects. The announcement must originate from official NASA sources or be covered by at least three major news outlets. The new environment must be clearly identified as a distinct project or initiative from current simulations. If no such declaration is made by the given date, or if the announced project simply extends or alters an existing simulation, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Conditional on NASA announcing a new type of simulated Mars environment focused on robotic exploration by July 2024, will the U.S. government resume consideration of geothermal energy projects by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, NASA officially announces the development or initiation of a new type of simulated Mars environment focused on robotic exploration that is distinct from any previously disclosed projects. The announcement must come from official NASA channels or be reported by at least three major news organizations, and the new environment must be explicitly described as a separate project or initiative from existing simulations. 

Given this, will the following be true: By July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at developing geothermal energy. The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of geothermal energy project applications by relevant federal agencies. If no such resumption occurs by the resolution date, or if the pause on consideration remains in effect, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

para_P.title: If NASA makes a public announcement about a new simulated Mars environment aimed at robotic exploration by July 2024, will the U.S. government begin reviewing geothermal energy initiatives again by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following is accurate: By July 31, 2024, NASA publicly reveals the creation or launch of a new simulated Mars environment specifically designed for robotic exploration, which is different from any previously announced projects. This announcement must come through official NASA sources or be covered by at least three major news outlets, and the new environment needs to be clearly identified as a distinct project from existing simulations. 

In light of this, will the following statement hold true: By July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government will have officially restarted the evaluation of projects related to the development of geothermal energy. This restart must be validated through official government communications or reports from a minimum of two credible news organizations (like Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The restart should include the active processing or assessment of geothermal energy project proposals by relevant federal bodies. If such a restart does not take place by the resolution date, or if the halt on consideration persists, the answer will be NO. It is important to note that this question does not necessitate the approval of any specific projects, only the resumption of the consideration process.

question.title: Conditional on NASA announcing a new simulated Mars environment and the U.S. government resuming geothermal energy projects by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) NASA officially announces the development of a new type of simulated Mars environment focused on robotic exploration, distinct from any previously disclosed projects, confirmed by official NASA channels or major news organizations, and described as a separate project from existing simulations. (b) The U.S. federal government officially resumes consideration of geothermal energy projects, confirmed by official announcements or reports from reputable news sources, involving active processing or review of geothermal project applications by relevant federal agencies.

Given these conditions, will the Saudi Arabian Monetary Authority officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed by official SAMA communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SAMA officials. The interest rate in question refers to the repo rate, SAMA's primary tool for monetary policy. The question resolves as YES if the announcement is made by August 31, 2024, and NO if not. If the initial conditions are not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If NASA reveals a new simulated environment for Mars and the U.S. government restarts geothermal energy initiatives by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true by July 31, 2024: (a) NASA officially discloses the creation of a novel simulated Mars environment aimed at robotic exploration, different from any previously announced projects, validated by official NASA communications or major news outlets, and characterized as an independent project from current simulations. (b) The U.S. federal government officially recommences the evaluation of geothermal energy initiatives, confirmed by official statements or reports from credible news organizations, involving active processing or assessment of geothermal project applications by relevant federal bodies.

Under these circumstances, will the Saudi Arabian Monetary Authority formally announce a decrease in interest rates to be effective by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be validated by official SAMA communications, such as press releases, statements, or public addresses by SAMA representatives. The interest rate in question pertains to the repo rate, which is SAMA's primary monetary policy instrument. The question is answered with YES if the announcement occurs by August 31, 2024, and NO if it does not. If the initial conditions are not satisfied, the question is considered N/A.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (1) NASA announce a new type of simulated Mars environment focused on robotic exploration, (2) the U.S. government resume consideration of geothermal energy projects, and (3) the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia announce an interest rate cut?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective deadlines: (1) By July 31, 2024, NASA officially announces the development or initiation of a new type of simulated Mars environment focused on robotic exploration that is distinct from any previously disclosed projects. The announcement must come from official NASA channels or be reported by at least three major news organizations. The new environment must be explicitly described as a separate project or initiative from existing simulations. (2) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government has officially resumed the consideration of projects aimed at developing geothermal energy. The resumption must be confirmed through official government announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The resumption should involve the active processing or review of geothermal energy project applications by relevant federal agencies. The announcement must be confirmed by official SAMA communications, such as press releases, statements, or public speeches by SAMA officials. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the repo rate, which is SAMA's primary tool for monetary policy. If any of these conditions is not met by their respective dates, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following take place: (1) NASA unveil a new simulated Mars environment aimed at robotic exploration, (2) the U.S. government renew its evaluation of geothermal energy initiatives, and (3) the Central Bank of Saudi Arabia declare a reduction in interest rates?
para_P.body: This question will be considered YES if all of the following criteria are fulfilled by their specified deadlines: (1) By July 31, 2024, NASA must officially reveal the creation or start of a new type of simulated Mars environment specifically for robotic exploration that is different from any previously announced projects. This announcement should come from official NASA sources or be covered by at least three major news outlets. The new environment must be clearly identified as a unique project or initiative apart from existing simulations. (2) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. federal government needs to have officially restarted the evaluation of projects related to the development of geothermal energy. This restart must be validated through official government communications or reports from at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or The Wall Street Journal). The restart should involve the active processing or assessment of geothermal energy project applications by relevant federal authorities. (3) By August 31, 2024, the Saudi Arabian Monetary Authority must officially announce a cut in interest rates that is set to take effect. This announcement needs to be confirmed by official SAMA communications, including press releases, statements, or public addresses by SAMA officials. It is important to note that the actual date for implementing the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the repo rate, which is the primary instrument of SAMA's monetary policy. If any of these conditions are not satisfied by their specified deadlines, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: Is the factory project of the Chinese battery company in Michigan going to be called off by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's initiative to construct a $2.36 billion facility in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially scrapped. Verification must be obtained from formal announcements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two reliable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or significant national newspapers). The cancellation must represent a complete cessation of the project, rather than merely a postponement or alteration. If the project remains in progress, under consideration, or has not been officially called off by that date, the inquiry will be considered negative. For the purposes of this question, 'cancellation' signifies that the company has formally retracted its plans or the state has unequivocally dismissed the project.

question.title: If the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan is canceled by August 2024, will the UK Education Department implement a plan to lower student loan payments by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, the UK Education Department has successfully implemented a plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers? The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the UK Education Department or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as BBC, The Guardian, or Financial Times). The plan must be a new initiative aimed at reducing monthly payments for a significant number of student loan borrowers. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the plan is blocked by further legal challenges, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Should the UK Education Department put into effect a strategy to reduce student loan payments by July 2024 if the Chinese battery manufacturer's factory initiative in Michigan is called off by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assume the following scenario: By August 31, 2024, it is verified that the Chinese lithium-ion battery manufacturer's intention to construct a $2.36 billion facility in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially scrapped. Verification must come from formal declarations by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two reputable news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or prominent national newspapers). The scrapping must be a total cancellation of the project, not merely a postponement or alteration. In this context, 'cancellation' implies that the company has officially retracted its proposals or the state has unequivocally dismissed the project.

Then, is it accurate that by July 31, 2024, the UK Education Department has effectively enacted a plan to decrease monthly payments for student loan borrowers? The enactment must be validated by official statements from the UK Education Department or reported by at least two leading news platforms (such as BBC, The Guardian, or Financial Times). The plan must represent a new effort aimed at lowering monthly payments for a considerable number of student loan borrowers. If no such enactment takes place by the specified resolution date, or if the plan faces further legal obstacles, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Given the Chinese battery factory project in Michigan is canceled and the UK Education Department lowers student loan payments, will the Reserve Bank of Australia announce interest rate hikes by August 2024?

Suppose the following is true: (1) The Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan has been officially canceled by August 31, 2024. This means the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan is confirmed canceled by official statements from the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources. The cancellation must be a complete termination, not just a delay or modification.

AND

(2) The UK Education Department has implemented a plan to lower student loan payments by July 31, 2024. This implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the UK Education Department or reported by at least two major news outlets. The plan must be a new initiative aimed at reducing monthly payments for a significant number of student loan borrowers.

Then, is it true that the Reserve Bank of Australia will announce interest rate hikes by August 31, 2024? This means the RBA officially announces the beginning of interest rate hikes through an official communication channel, explicitly stating the intention to increase the cash rate from its current level, and this is reported by at least two major financial news outlets.

para_P.title: If the Chinese battery manufacturing project in Michigan is called off and the UK Education Department reduces student loan repayments, will the Reserve Bank of Australia declare an increase in interest rates by August 2024?

Assuming the following conditions hold: (1) The factory project of the Chinese battery company in Michigan has been definitively canceled by August 31, 2024. AND

Then, is it accurate to say that the Reserve Bank of Australia will reveal plans for interest rate increases by August 31, 2024? This implies that the RBA officially communicates the initiation of interest rate hikes through a formal channel, clearly indicating the aim to raise the cash rate from its present level, and this is covered by at least two significant financial news organizations.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) The Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024, (2) The UK Education Department implement a plan to lower student loan payments by July 2024, and (3) The Reserve Bank of Australia announce interest rate hikes by August 2024?
question.body:
(1) The Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan will be considered canceled if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

(2) The UK Education Department will be considered to have implemented a plan to lower student loan payments if, by July 31, 2024, the department has successfully implemented a plan to lower monthly payments for student loan borrowers. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the UK Education Department or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as BBC, The Guardian, or Financial Times). The plan must be a new initiative aimed at reducing monthly payments for a significant number of student loan borrowers. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the plan is blocked by further legal challenges, the question resolves as NO.

(3) This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of Australia officially announces the beginning of interest rate hikes. The announcement must come from an official RBA communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the RBA Governor. The announcement should explicitly state the intention to increase the cash rate from its current level. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the RBA maintains or cuts interest rates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it certain that all of the following will happen: (1) The factory project of the Chinese battery company in Michigan will be scrapped by August 2024, (2) The UK Education Department will enact a strategy to reduce student loan repayments by July 2024, and (3) The Reserve Bank of Australia will declare increases in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body:
(1) The factory project of the Chinese battery company in Michigan will be deemed scrapped if, by August 31, 2024, it is verified that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's initiative to construct a $2.36 billion facility in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially abandoned. Verification must come from formal statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two trustworthy news sources (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The scrapping must be a complete cessation of the project, not merely a postponement or alteration. If the project remains in progress, under assessment, or has not been officially scrapped by this date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purposes of this inquiry, 'scrapping' signifies that the company has formally retracted its plans or the state has definitively denied the project.

(2) The UK Education Department will be regarded as having enacted a strategy to reduce student loan repayments if, by July 31, 2024, the department has effectively put into action a plan to decrease monthly payments for student loan borrowers. The enactment must be confirmed by official announcements from the UK Education Department or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as BBC, The Guardian, or Financial Times). The strategy must be a new initiative aimed at lowering monthly payments for a substantial number of student loan borrowers. If no such enactment occurs by the resolution date, or if the plan is hindered by further legal obstacles, the question will resolve as NO.

(3) This inquiry will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Reserve Bank of Australia officially declares the commencement of interest rate increases. The declaration must originate from an official RBA communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public address by the RBA Governor. The declaration should explicitly express the intention to raise the cash rate from its current position. The declaration must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such declaration is made by the specified date, or if the RBA maintains or reduces interest rates, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will U.S. monthly inflation rate exceed 5% for three consecutive months by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the U.S. monthly inflation rate, as reported by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, exceeds 5% for three consecutive months at any point between now and August 31, 2024. The question will resolve as NO if this condition is not met within the specified timeframe. For resolution purposes, only official data released by the Bureau of Labor Statistics will be considered.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the monthly inflation rate in the U.S. will stay above 5% for three straight months before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the monthly inflation rate in the U.S., as documented by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, remains above 5% for three consecutive months at any time from now until August 31, 2024. A NO response will be given if this scenario does not occur within the designated period. For the purpose of resolution, only official statistics published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics will be taken into account.

question.title: Given U.S. monthly inflation rate exceeds 5% for three consecutive months by August 2024, will Wisconsin's Medicaid expansion enroll over 200,000 people by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The U.S. monthly inflation rate, as reported by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, exceeds 5% for three consecutive months at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Then, will Wisconsin's Medicaid expansion program enroll more than 200,000 residents by July 31, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: The condition is met if the U.S. monthly inflation rate exceeds 5% for three consecutive months within the specified timeframe, according to official data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The question resolves as YES if Wisconsin's Medicaid expansion program enrolls more than 200,000 residents by July 31, 2024, confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the enrollment does not exceed 200,000 by the resolution date, or if reliable data is not available, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the U.S. monthly inflation rate is higher than 5% for three consecutive months by August 2024, will Wisconsin's Medicaid expansion have more than 200,000 enrollees by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The monthly inflation rate in the U.S., as published by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, surpasses 5% for three consecutive months at any time before August 31, 2024. Then, will the Medicaid expansion initiative in Wisconsin enroll over 200,000 individuals by July 31, 2024?

Criteria for meeting the condition: The condition is satisfied if the U.S. monthly inflation rate is greater than 5% for three consecutive months during the given period, based on official data from the Bureau of Labor Statistics.

Criteria for determining the outcome: The question is answered with YES if Wisconsin's Medicaid expansion program has more than 200,000 enrollees by July 31, 2024, as verified by official state announcements or reported by at least two credible news outlets. If the enrollment does not exceed 200,000 by the resolution date, or if trustworthy data is unavailable, the question is answered with NO.

question.title: Given both high U.S. inflation and significant Wisconsin Medicaid enrollment, will the U.S. maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese clothing through August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: (a) The U.S. monthly inflation rate exceeds 5% for three consecutive months at any point between now and August 31, 2024, as reported by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, and (b) Wisconsin's Medicaid expansion program enrolls more than 200,000 residents by July 31, 2024, with enrollment figures confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Then, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made clothing through August 31, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made clothing, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. Resolves NO if the tariff is reduced below 100% or removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution.

para_P.title: In light of elevated inflation rates in the U.S. and a notable rise in Wisconsin's Medicaid enrollment, will the U.S. sustain a full 100% tariff on clothing imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) The monthly inflation rate in the U.S. surpasses 5% for three consecutive months at any time before August 31, 2024, as indicated by the Bureau of Labor Statistics, and (b) Wisconsin's Medicaid expansion program has more than 200,000 residents enrolled by July 31, 2024, with these enrollment numbers verified by official state announcements or reported by at least two credible news outlets. Then, will the United States continue to enforce a 100% tariff on clothing manufactured in China until August 31, 2024? 

Resolution criteria: Resolves YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States still applies a 100% tariff on imports of clothing from China, as confirmed by official U.S. government sources and supported by at least two trustworthy news organizations. question.title: Given the Reserve Bank of Australia announces a rate cut by August 2024, will Google resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:

A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction.

Given this, will Google reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid:

4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Reserve Bank of Australia announces a reduction in its key interest rate, (b) Google resolves a major workers' strike, and (c) Tennessee enacts new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers?

This question will resolve as YES only if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) The Reserve Bank of Australia must publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. (b) Google must reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:
  1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Google workers (at least 1,000 participants).
  2. The strike must last for at least one week.
  3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Google and the involved union.
  4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

(c) Tennessee must enact new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The overall question resolves as YES only if (a), (b), and (c) all resolve as YES. If any part resolves as NO, the overall question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following take place: (a) The Reserve Bank of Australia declares a decrease in its main interest rate, (b) Google successfully negotiates an end to a significant workers' strike, and (c) Tennessee implements new abortion laws that are more stringent than those applicable to other medical providers?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES only if all of the following criteria are fulfilled:

(a) The Reserve Bank of Australia must formally announce a decrease in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024. This announcement needs to be officially issued by the Reserve Bank of Australia and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The decrease must pertain to the cash rate, which is the RBA's primary mechanism for economic influence. Mere suggestions or speculations about future rate reductions do not qualify; there must be a definitive announcement of an actual rate cut. If such an announcement is not made by the specified date, this component resolves as NO.

(b) Google must finalize a deal with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For this resolution to be deemed valid:
  1. The strike must include a considerable number of Google employees (at least 1,000 participants).
  2. The strike must persist for a minimum of one week.
  3. The conclusion must be validated by official statements from both Google and the participating union.
  4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no resolution meeting all these conditions is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, this part resolves as NO.

(c) Tennessee must pass new laws or regulations by July 31, 2024, that impose more stringent requirements on abortion providers than those for other healthcare providers. The passage must be confirmed by official state legislative records or reported by at least two reliable news sources. Stricter requirements may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specifically for abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any laws or regulations enacted apply equally to all healthcare providers, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question resolves as YES only if (a), (b), and (c) all resolve as YES. If any part resolves as NO, the overall question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Georgia hold a referendum on minimum wage laws by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on minimum wage laws. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address minimum wage laws, either proposing to increase, decrease, or maintain them. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on minimum wage does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on Georgia holding a referendum on minimum wage laws by August 2024, will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration? The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy. If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 250,000 for five consecutive weeks by August 2024, will a major South Korean battery company begin construction of a factory in Michigan by August 2024?

The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (1) The number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 250,000 for five consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for this condition. (2) Construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in Michigan, owned by a South Korean company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the Michigan state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. (3) Construction on a large-scale lithium-ion battery factory in California, owned by a Chinese company, has officially commenced. Confirmation must come from at least two of the following sources: official company announcements, statements from the California state government, or reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal). The commencement of construction should involve significant on-site activities such as groundbreaking, foundation work, or major earthmoving operations. Mere preparatory activities like site clearing or permitting processes do not qualify as construction commencement. If any of these conditions are not met by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Chuck Schumer publicly retract his statement about Biden's stance on renewable energy?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Chuck Schumer publicly retracts or significantly alters his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on renewable energy. The retraction or alteration must be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as CNN, Fox News, MSNBC, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). A significant alteration would involve a substantial change to the core message of his original statement, not just a minor clarification or rewording. If no such retraction or significant alteration is reported by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'publicly' means through official statements, interviews, social media posts from verified accounts, or during public appearances.

A substantial modification would mean a significant shift in the essential message of his initial remarks, rather than a trivial clarification or rephrasing. If no retraction or substantial modification is reported by the given deadline, the inquiry will be resolved as NO. In this context, 'publicly' refers to official statements, interviews, verified social media posts, or comments made during public events.

question.title: Conditional on Chuck Schumer retracting his statement about Biden's renewable energy stance, will an FDA-approved nasal spray for insomnia be available by August 2024?
question.body:

For the condition to be true, by August 31, 2024, Chuck Schumer must publicly retract or significantly alter his statement regarding Joe Biden's position on renewable energy, with the retraction or alteration reported by at least two major news outlets. The change must be substantial, not a minor clarification.

For the outcome, an FDA-approved nasal spray for treating insomnia must be available for purchase in at least one major U.S. pharmacy chain by the same date. This availability must be confirmed through official announcements or reports from reputable news sources. The spray must be specifically approved for insomnia treatment.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

question.title: Will a court rule on the liability of a major hotel chain operator by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court of law issues a ruling on whether a major hotel chain operator is liable for negligence or gross negligence in relation to an incident resulting in significant harm or loss. If no such ruling occurs by the resolution date, or if the case is settled out of court without a formal ruling, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not require the court to find the operator liable; it only requires a ruling to be made on the matter of liability.

question.title: Will the U.S. Senate pass a bill to increase the Department of Education's budget by more than 20% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate passes a bill that includes an increase of more than 20% in the budget of the Department of Education compared to its current fiscal year's budget. The passage must be confirmed by official Senate records and reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post). If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget increase is 20% or less, the question resolves as NO. Note that mere proposals or discussions of budget increases do not count; the bill must be officially passed by the Senate.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. Senate approve legislation to boost the Department of Education's funding by over 20% before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, the United States Senate approves legislation that entails a funding increase exceeding 20% for the Department of Education's budget relative to its current fiscal year. The approval must be validated by official Senate records and covered by at least two prominent news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, or The Washington Post). If the Senate does not pass such legislation by the specified date, or if a bill is approved but the funding increase is 20% or less, the inquiry will be deemed negative. It is important to note that simply proposing or discussing budget increases is insufficient; the legislation must be officially sanctioned by the Senate.

question.title: Conditional on the U.S. Senate passing a bill to increase the Department of Education's budget by more than 20% by August 2024, will Oklahoma enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?

The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by the resolution date, or if a bill is passed but the budget increase is 20% or less, this condition resolves as NO. (2) By July 31, 2024, Oklahoma enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, this condition resolves as NO. (3) By July 31, 2024, the state of California enacts a new law that modifies or replaces the current restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. The enactment must be confirmed through official state legislative records and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or local California news stations). The new law must specifically address and alter the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth in California. If no such law is enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted law does not modify the current restrictions, the question resolves as NO. The overall question resolves as YES only if all three conditions are met; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

The regulations should specifically aim to decrease the number of short-term rental properties accessible to tourists or change their operational methods. Simple discussions or proposals without a formal declaration will not suffice for a YES outcome. If no such official declaration is made by the resolution date, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Given Hong Kong announces plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electronics through August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the city government of Hong Kong officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units within the city, with the announcement reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. Then, is it true that the United States will maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electronics through August 31, 2024? 

Resolution criteria for the condition: The announcement must come from an official source within Hong Kong's local government, targeting the reduction of short-term rental units or altering their operation. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement do not count.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: The U.S. must continue to impose a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electronics as of August 31, 2024, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. para_P.title: If Hong Kong declares its intentions to limit short-term rental properties by July 2024, will the United States uphold a 100% tariff on electronics manufactured in China until August 2024?
para_P.body:

Criteria for assessing the outcome: The U.S. must persist in enforcing a 100% tariff on electronics produced in China as of August 31, 2024, verifiable through official U.S. government channels and supported by at least two credible news organizations. question.title: Given Hong Kong restricts short-term rentals and the US maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese electronics, will the FDA recall ground parsley due to lead by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both of the following conditions are met: (a) By July 31, 2024, the city government of Hong Kong officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units. This announcement must be from an official source within Hong Kong's local government and reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions should specifically target reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering their operation. (b) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made electronics, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this condition is not met. Temporary suspensions or waivers do not affect this resolution. Both conditions must be satisfied for this assumption to hold.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) will officially issue a recall for any ground parsley products due to lead contamination? This recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations. A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, this resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Considering that Hong Kong imposes limitations on short-term rentals and the United States upholds a full 100% tariff on Chinese electronics, will the FDA initiate a recall of ground parsley due to lead contamination by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Both of these conditions are satisfied: (a) By July 31, 2024, the local government of Hong Kong officially declares plans or regulations designed to restrict or limit the number of short-term rental units. This declaration must come from an official Hong Kong government source and be reported by at least two credible international news outlets. The restrictions should specifically aim to decrease the availability of short-term rental units for tourists or modify their operation. Both conditions must be fulfilled for this assumption to be valid.

This recall must be validated through official announcements from the FDA or reports from at least two major news organizations. A recall is defined as a formal request from the FDA for manufacturers to withdraw their products from the market. Alerts or warnings without an official recall do not count for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, this will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (1) Hong Kong announces plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024, (2) the United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made electronics through August 2024, and (3) the FDA issues a recall for ground parsley products due to lead contamination by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met: (1) By July 31, 2024, the city government of Hong Kong officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Hong Kong's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. (2) As of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made electronics. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question. (3) By July 31, 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially issues a recall for any ground parsley products due to lead contamination. The recall must be confirmed through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request by the FDA for manufacturers to remove their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not qualify for a YES resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. All conditions must be satisfied for this question to resolve as YES; otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following three events will take place: (1) by July 2024, Hong Kong will declare intentions to limit short-term rental units, (2) the U.S. will keep a 100% tariff on electronics made in China until August 2024, and (3) the FDA will announce a recall for ground parsley due to lead contamination by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if all of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled: (1) By the end of July 2024, the Hong Kong city government makes an official declaration or regulation aimed at curtailing the availability of short-term rental units (like those found on platforms such as Airbnb) within the city. This declaration must originate from a recognized source within Hong Kong's local government and be reported by at least two credible international news outlets. The regulations should specifically focus on decreasing the number of short-term rental units accessible to tourists or modifying their operational methods. Simple discussions or proposals lacking a formal declaration will not suffice for an affirmative resolution. If no such official declaration occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved negatively. (2) As of the end of August 2024, the United States continues to enforce a 100% tariff on the importation of Chinese-manufactured electronics. The presence and rate of this tariff must be verifiable via official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). Should the tariff be lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the inquiry will resolve negatively. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly characterized as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this inquiry. (3) By the end of July 2024, the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) officially announces a recall for any ground parsley products due to lead contamination. This recall must be verified through official FDA announcements or reports from at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Washington Post). A recall is defined as a formal request from the FDA for manufacturers to withdraw their products from the market. Warnings or alerts without an official recall do not meet the criteria for an affirmative resolution. If no such recall is issued by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves negatively. All criteria must be met for this inquiry to resolve affirmatively; otherwise, it resolves negatively.

question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made steel. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the United States continue to enforce a full 100% tariff on steel imported from China until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, on August 31, 2024, the United States is still applying a 100% tariff on the importation of steel produced in China. The presence and level of the tariff must be confirmed through official sources from the U.S. government (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (for instance, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). If the tariff is lowered below 100% or completely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with a NO. Temporary suspensions or exemptions of the tariff that are clearly indicated as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this inquiry.

question.title: Given the U.S. maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese steel, will jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four weeks by Aug 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel through August 31, 2024. This means that as of August 31, 2024, the U.S. continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made steel, as verified by official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not permanently alter the 100% rate are not considered a reduction.

Then, is it true that U.S. weekly jobless claims will exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks by August 2024? For this to be true, the number of weekly initial jobless claims, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, must exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: If the United States upholds a 100% tariff on steel from China, will the number of jobless claims surpass 275,000 for a period of four weeks by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds: The U.S. enforces a 100% tariff on steel imported from China until August 31, 2024. This indicates that as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to apply a 100% tariff on Chinese steel imports, as confirmed by official U.S. government sources and supported by at least two credible news outlets. Temporary exemptions or suspensions that do not permanently change the 100% tariff rate are not regarded as a reduction.

Therefore, is it accurate to say that the weekly jobless claims in the U.S. will go beyond 275,000 for four straight weeks by August 2024? For this to be correct, the weekly initial jobless claims, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, must exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any time from now until August 31, 2024.

question.title: Given both the U.S. maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel and U.S. jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four weeks, will a major oil spill occur in the Baltic Sea by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: 
1. The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel, verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by reputable news organizations, without reduction or removal of the tariff.
2. U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks, based on official data from the U.S. Department of Labor.

Given these conditions, will there be a confirmed major oil spill in the Baltic Sea by August 31, 2024? A major oil spill is defined as one reported by at least two reputable international news sources, causing significant environmental damage and requiring large-scale cleanup efforts, directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Baltic Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the U.S. continues to impose a 100% tariff on steel imported from China and if jobless claims in the U.S. remain above 275,000 for four consecutive weeks, will there be a significant oil spill in the Baltic Sea before August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following criteria are satisfied by August 31, 2024: 
1. The United States upholds a full 100% tariff on steel produced in China, which can be verified through official U.S. government publications and confirmed by credible news outlets, with no decrease or elimination of the tariff.
2. The weekly jobless claims in the U.S. surpass 275,000 for four straight weeks, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor's official statistics.

Under these circumstances, will there be a verified significant oil spill in the Baltic Sea by August 31, 2024? A significant oil spill is characterized as one that is reported by at least two credible international news agencies, resulting in considerable environmental harm and necessitating extensive cleanup operations, directly associated with an assault by a local militant group on a tanker in the Baltic Sea. If such a spill does not occur by the outlined date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel, (2) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks, and (3) A major oil spill occurs in the Baltic Sea due to a militant attack?
question.body:
(1) The United States maintains a 100% tariff on Chinese-made steel: This condition will be met if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made steel. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, this condition will not be met. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect this condition.

(2) U.S. weekly jobless claims exceed 275,000 for four consecutive weeks: This condition will be met if the number of weekly initial jobless claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point between now and August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be considered for this condition. If this condition is not met within the specified timeframe, it will not be satisfied.

(3) A major oil spill occurs in the Baltic Sea due to a militant attack: This condition will be met if, by August 31, 2024, there is a confirmed major oil spill in the Baltic Sea resulting from any tanker attacked by a regional militant group. A major oil spill is defined as a spill that is reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and causes significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Baltic Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that by August 2024, the following will take place: (1) The United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on steel imported from China, (2) Weekly unemployment claims in the U.S. surpass 275,000 for four weeks in a row, and (3) A significant oil spill happens in the Baltic Sea as a result of an attack by militants?
para_P.body:
(1) The United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on steel imported from China: This requirement will be fulfilled if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States still enforces a 100% tariff on Chinese steel imports. The presence and percentage of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (like the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and confirmed by at least two credible news outlets (for example, Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is decreased below 100% or entirely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this requirement will not be satisfied. Temporary suspensions or exemptions of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not impact this requirement.

(2) Weekly unemployment claims in the U.S. surpass 275,000 for four weeks in a row: This requirement will be fulfilled if the number of initial weekly unemployment claims in the United States, as reported by the U.S. Department of Labor, exceeds 275,000 for four consecutive weeks at any point before August 31, 2024. Only official data released by the U.S. Department of Labor will be taken into account for this requirement. If this requirement is not met within the designated timeframe, it will not be fulfilled.

(3) A significant oil spill occurs in the Baltic Sea due to a militant attack: This requirement will be fulfilled if, by August 31, 2024, there is a verified major oil spill in the Baltic Sea caused by an attack on a tanker by a regional militant group. A significant oil spill is defined as one that is reported by at least two reputable international news agencies (such as Reuters, AP, BBC, or Al Jazeera) and results in considerable environmental harm, necessitating extensive cleanup operations. The spill must be directly associated with an attack by a regional militant group on a tanker in the Baltic Sea. If no such spill occurs by the specified deadline, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Bank of England announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of England publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of England declare a cut in its main interest rate before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if the Bank of England officially declares a cut in its main interest rate by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be made publicly by the Bank of England and covered by at least two credible financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The cut must pertain to the Bank Rate, which is the primary mechanism the Bank of England uses to steer the economy. Simple suggestions or conjectures regarding future rate cuts do not meet the criteria; there must be a definitive announcement of a real rate cut. If no such declaration occurs by the designated date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Conditional on the Bank of England announcing a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024, will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a mental health support requirement by July 2024?

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a mental health support requirement for beneficiaries? The mental health support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the Bank of England reveals a decrease in its primary interest rate by August 2024, will another state in the U.S. implement a Medicaid program that mandates mental health support by July 2024?
