question.title: Will the Bank of Canada announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoC members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of Canada declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Bank of Canada formally declares a reduction in its overnight rate target by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be verified through official communications from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Governing Council and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual members of the BoC will not be considered for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Given the Bank of Canada announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with an employment support requirement by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target by July 31, 2024. The announcement is confirmed through official statements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut is a formal decision made by the Governing Council and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting.

Then, is it true that by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes an employment support requirement for beneficiaries? The employment support requirement must be a key component of the plan. There must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration.

para_P.title: If the Bank of Canada makes a declaration of an interest rate reduction by July 2024, will any U.S. state besides Georgia implement a Medicaid program that mandates employment support by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Bank of Canada publicly declares a reduction in its overnight rate target by July 31, 2024. This declaration is verified through official communications from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two significant financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction is a formal resolution made by the Governing Council and conveyed in their official statement or during a press conference after a meeting.

Then, is it accurate to say that by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid program that incorporates a requirement for employment support for beneficiaries? The employment support requirement must be an essential aspect of the program. There needs to be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from at least two credible national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, not merely proposed or considered.

question.title: Given both a Bank of Canada rate cut and a new U.S. state Medicaid employment support plan by July 2024, will GM resolve a major strike by then?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target, confirmed by official statements or major financial news sources, and (b) At least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan with an employment support requirement, confirmed by official announcements or reputable news sources.

Given these conditions, will General Motors reach an agreement with unionized workers to end a significant strike by July 31, 2024? The strike must involve at least 1,000 workers, last at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by both GM and the union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

If the conditions (a) and (b) are met, does General Motors resolve the strike as described?

para_P.title: If the Bank of Canada reduces its interest rate and a new Medicaid employment support initiative is implemented by a U.S. state by July 2024, will GM settle a significant strike by that time?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada publicly declares a reduction in its overnight rate target, as reported by official statements or major financial media, and (b) At least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially introduces a Medicaid plan that includes an employment support component, verified by official announcements or trustworthy news outlets.

Under these circumstances, will General Motors come to an agreement with unionized employees to conclude a major strike by July 31, 2024? This strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 workers, continue for at least one week, and the resolution must be acknowledged by both GM and the union, as well as reported by no fewer than two reputable international news agencies.

If conditions (a) and (b) are satisfied, will General Motors resolve the strike as outlined?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada announces an interest rate cut, (b) Another U.S. state adopts a Medicaid plan with an employment support requirement, and (c) General Motors resolves a major workers' strike?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following events occur by July 31, 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada officially announces a decrease in its overnight rate target. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Bank of Canada or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual BoC members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, this part resolves as NO. (b) At least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes an employment support requirement for beneficiaries. The employment support requirement must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, this part resolves as NO. (c) General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid: 1. The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants). 2. The strike must last for at least one week. 3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both General Motors and the involved union. 4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO. If all parts (a), (b), and (c) occur, the question resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following three events take place: (a) The Bank of Canada declares a reduction in interest rates, (b) Another state in the U.S. implements a Medicaid program with a requirement for employment support, and (c) General Motors successfully negotiates to conclude a significant workers' strike?

(b) At least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, officially implements a Medicaid program that incorporates a requirement for employment support for beneficiaries. The employment support requirement must be a fundamental aspect of the program. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from at least two reputable national news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially adopted, not just proposed or under consideration. If no other state implements such a program by July 31, 2024, this aspect resolves as NO. (c) General Motors comes to an agreement with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be deemed valid: 1. The strike must involve a significant number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants). 2. The strike must endure for a minimum of one week. 3. The resolution must be corroborated by official statements from both General Motors and the relevant union. 4. The resolution must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the designated date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO. If all parts (a), (b), and (c) occur, the inquiry resolves as YES. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of South Korea announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of South Korea or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of South Korea members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Bank of Korea declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Bank of Korea formally declares a reduction in its Base Rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Bank of Korea or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and conveyed in their official statement or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding potential future rate reductions or unofficial remarks by individual members of the Bank of Korea will not be taken into account for resolution. If no such official declaration of an interest rate reduction is made by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as negative.

question.title: Conditional on the Central Bank of South Korea announcing an interest rate cut by July 2024, will Massachusetts implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate by July 31, 2024. This announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank members will not count for resolution.

Given this condition, will Massachusetts implement a free community college plan by July 2024? This will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Massachusetts has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local Massachusetts newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the Central Bank of South Korea declares an interest rate reduction by July 2024, will Massachusetts adopt a tuition-free community college initiative by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: The Central Bank of South Korea makes an official declaration to lower its Base Rate by July 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through formal announcements from the Central Bank or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Monetary Policy Board and conveyed in their official statement or press conference after a meeting. Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or informal comments from individual Central Bank members will not be considered for resolution.

Under this premise, will Massachusetts adopt a tuition-free community college initiative by July 2024? This will be considered a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Massachusetts has officially enacted a tuition-free community college initiative. Confirmation of implementation occurs if students can enroll in community colleges without paying tuition fees, as reported by at least two credible news sources (such as local Massachusetts newspapers, national news organizations, or official announcements from the state government). The initiative must be part of a comprehensive state-wide program, not restricted to specific colleges or pilot initiatives. If no such initiative is enacted by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or restricted, the question will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Given both the Central Bank of South Korea announces an interest rate cut and Massachusetts implements a free community college plan by July 2024, will Google fund full tuition for all MIT engineering students by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea officially announces a decrease in its Base Rate, confirmed through official statements or reported by major financial news sources, and (b) Massachusetts officially implements a free community college plan, confirmed by reputable news sources or official state announcements. Then, will Google's funding be used to cover full tuition for all engineering students at MIT, as confirmed by official university announcements or reputable news sources? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For the condition: Both (a) and (b) must occur by the resolution date for the condition to be true. If either event does not occur, the condition is false.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Google's funding covers full tuition for all MIT engineering students by the resolution date, confirmed by official announcements or reputable news sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If the Central Bank of South Korea decides to lower interest rates and Massachusetts introduces a plan for free community college by July 2024, will Google provide full tuition for every engineering student at MIT by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea publicly declares a reduction in its Base Rate, as verified by official statements or major financial news outlets, and (b) Massachusetts successfully rolls out a free community college initiative, as confirmed by credible news sources or official state communications. Then, will Google's financial support be allocated to pay full tuition for all engineering students at MIT, as verified by official university announcements or trusted news organizations? 

Resolution criteria: 
- For the condition: Both (a) and (b) must take place by the resolution date for the condition to be regarded as true. If either event does not transpire, the condition is deemed false.
- For the outcome: Resolves YES if Google's funding is utilized to cover full tuition for all engineering students at MIT by the resolution date, as confirmed by official announcements or trusted news sources. Resolves NO in all other cases.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea announces an interest rate cut (b) Massachusetts implements a free community college plan (c) Google funds full tuition for all MIT engineering students?

The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of South Korea members will not count for resolution. (b) Massachusetts officially implements a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources such as local Massachusetts newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements. The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. (c) Google's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all engineering students at MIT, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If any of these events does not occur by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will the following three events take place: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea makes an announcement about lowering interest rates (b) Massachusetts launches a tuition-free community college initiative (c) Google provides full tuition coverage for every MIT engineering student?
para_P.body: This query will be answered with a YES if all of the subsequent occurrences transpire by July 31, 2024: (a) The Central Bank of South Korea makes a formal announcement regarding a reduction in its Base Rate. This must be validated through official communications from the Central Bank of South Korea or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Board and communicated in their formal statements or press conferences following their meetings. Any speculation regarding potential future cuts or unofficial remarks from individual members of the Central Bank of South Korea will not be considered for resolution. (b) Massachusetts officially rolls out a tuition-free community college program. Implementation is confirmed if students can enroll in community colleges without incurring tuition costs, as reported by at least two credible news sources such as local Massachusetts newspapers, national news organizations, or official announcements from the state government. The initiative must be a state-wide program, not restricted to specific colleges or experimental projects. (c) Google’s financial support is utilized to fully cover the tuition for all engineering students at MIT, irrespective of their family income. Confirmation must come from official university communications or reports from at least two trustworthy news sources. If any of these events fails to occur by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Turkey announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Turkey officially announces a decrease in its policy rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Turkey or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Turkey members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the Central Bank of Turkey will declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the Central Bank of Turkey makes an official declaration regarding a reduction in its policy interest rate no later than July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the Central Bank of Turkey or reported by a minimum of two prominent financial news outlets (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a sanctioned decision by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual members of the Central Bank of Turkey will not be acknowledged for resolution. If no such formal announcement regarding an interest rate cut is made by the specified resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Given the Central Bank of Turkey announces an interest rate cut by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Mexico announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: The Central Bank of Turkey officially announces a decrease in its policy rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement is confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Turkey or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut is a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Turkey members do not count for resolution.

Given this, will the Central Bank of Mexico officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy.

para_P.title: If the Central Bank of Turkey declares a reduction in interest rates by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Mexico declare a reduction in interest rates by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statement holds true: The Central Bank of Turkey officially declares a reduction in its policy interest rate by July 31, 2024. This declaration must be validated through official announcements from the Central Bank of Turkey or reported by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction should be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference after a meeting. Any speculation regarding future rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual members of the Central Bank of Turkey do not count for resolution.

In light of this, will the Central Bank of Mexico officially declare an interest rate reduction to be effective by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed through official communications from the Bank of Mexico, such as press releases, statements from the Governing Board, or public addresses by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. It is important to note that the actual date for implementing the rate reduction may be after August 31, 2024, provided the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the primary monetary policy instrument of the Central Bank of Mexico.

question.title: Given both the Central Bank of Turkey and the Central Bank of Mexico announce interest rate cuts by August 2024, will the FTC's rule banning noncompete agreements be reinstated by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: Both the Central Bank of Turkey and the Central Bank of Mexico announce interest rate cuts by August 2024. Specifically, the Central Bank of Turkey must officially announce a decrease in its policy rate by July 31, 2024, confirmed through official statements or major financial news sources, and the Central Bank of Mexico must announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official communications. Given this, will the FTC's rule banning noncompete agreements, which was blocked by a federal judge in Texas, be reinstated by August 31, 2024? This reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the FTC, court rulings, or authoritative legal sources, and reported by major news outlets. The rule must be effectively reinstated, not merely proposed or pending, by the resolution date. Partial reinstatements or modifications that still substantially ban noncompete agreements qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If both the Central Bank of Turkey and the Central Bank of Mexico declare reductions in interest rates by August 2024, will the FTC's prohibition on noncompete agreements be restored by August 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following holds true: Both the Central Bank of Turkey and the Central Bank of Mexico declare reductions in interest rates by August 2024. In particular, the Central Bank of Turkey must officially state a reduction in its policy rate by July 31, 2024, verified through official statements or prominent financial news sources, and the Central Bank of Mexico must announce an interest rate reduction to take effect by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official communications. Given this scenario, will the FTC's prohibition on noncompete agreements, which was suspended by a federal judge in Texas, be restored by August 31, 2024? This restoration must be validated through official announcements from the FTC, court decisions, or credible legal sources, and reported by major news organizations. The rule must be fully reinstated, not just suggested or awaiting approval, by the resolution date. Any partial reinstatements or changes that still significantly restrict noncompete agreements qualify for a YES answer.

question.title: Will both of the following occur by August 2024: (1) The Central Bank of Turkey and the Central Bank of Mexico announce interest rate cuts, and (2) The FTC's rule banning noncompete agreements is reinstated?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if both of the following occur: (1) Both of the following occur: (a) The Central Bank of Turkey officially announces a decrease in its policy rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Central Bank of Turkey or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual Central Bank of Turkey members will not count for resolution. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Mexico communications, such as press releases, Governing Board statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the Central Bank of Mexico's primary tool for monetary policy. (2) The Federal Trade Commission's rule banning noncompete agreements, which was blocked by a federal judge in Texas, is reinstated through legal or administrative means by August 31, 2024. Reinstatement must be confirmed through official announcements by the FTC, court rulings, or other authoritative legal sources, and reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The reinstatement must be effective and not merely proposed or pending. If the rule is not reinstated and in effect by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Partial reinstatements or modifications to the original rule that still substantially ban noncompete agreements would qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following two events will take place by August 2024: (1) The Central Banks of Turkey and Mexico announce reductions in their interest rates, and (2) The FTC's regulation against noncompete agreements is restored?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if both of the following conditions are met: (1) Both of the subsequent events occur: (a) The Central Bank of Turkey officially declares a reduction in its policy interest rate by July 31, 2024. This declaration must be substantiated through official communications from the Central Bank of Turkey or reported by at least two significant financial news organizations (like Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be a formal resolution made by the Monetary Policy Committee and disclosed in their official statement or press conference after a meeting. Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or informal comments from individual members of the Central Bank of Turkey will not be considered valid for resolution. (b) The Central Bank of Mexico publicly announces a decrease in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be verified by official communications from the Bank of Mexico, such as press releases, statements from the Governing Board, or public addresses by Bank officials. If such an announcement is not made by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO. It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate cut can occur after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the target for the overnight interbank interest rate, which is the primary monetary policy instrument of the Central Bank of Mexico. (2) The Federal Trade Commission's regulation prohibiting noncompete agreements, which was halted by a federal judge in Texas, is restored through legal or administrative actions by August 31, 2024. The restoration must be confirmed through official announcements by the FTC, court decisions, or other credible legal sources, and reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The restoration must be effective and not simply a proposal or pending action. If the regulation is not reinstated and operational by August 31, 2024, the inquiry resolves as NO. Any partial reinstatements or alterations to the original regulation that still significantly restrict noncompete agreements would qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will the International Monetary Fund announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the International Monetary Fund declare new financial commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund publicly declares one or more new financial commitments that together surpass $400 million. The declaration(s) must be issued through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The financial commitments must represent new initiatives or significant extensions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously disclosed commitments. If no such declaration occurs by the resolution date, or if the total of new financial commitments does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.title: Given the IMF announces new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024, will a South Korean battery company's factory project in Ohio be canceled by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the International Monetary Fund officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official IMF channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Then, will a South Korean lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a factory in Ohio be officially canceled by August 31, 2024? Confirmation of the cancellation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

para_P.title: If the IMF reveals new funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024, will a factory project by a South Korean battery manufacturer in Ohio be scrapped by August 2024?

The funding commitments should represent new initiatives or significant expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously disclosed commitments.

Confirmation of the cancellation must be provided through official statements from the company, the state of Ohio, or at least two trustworthy news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must entail a complete cessation of the project, not merely a postponement or alteration. If the project remains active, under consideration, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the answer to the question will be NO. question.title: Given both the IMF announces over $400M funding and a South Korean battery factory project in Ohio is canceled, will J.C. Penney emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?
question.body:

Penney officially emerges from bankruptcy by this date, confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets or through official statements or court documents, involving a court-approved reorganization plan. Otherwise, it resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If the IMF reveals funding exceeding $400 million and a South Korean battery plant project in Ohio is scrapped, will J.C. Penney exit bankruptcy by July 2024?

Penney officially exits bankruptcy by this date, as confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets or through official announcements or court documents, involving a court-sanctioned reorganization plan. Otherwise, it is deemed a NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) The IMF announces new funding commitments over $400 million by July 2024, (b) A South Korean battery company's Ohio factory project is canceled by August 2024, and (c) J.C. Penney emerges from bankruptcy by July 2024?

Penney successfully exits bankruptcy by July 2024?

(c) J.C. Penney must officially exit Chapter 11 bankruptcy by July 31, 2024. Penney remains in bankruptcy, is liquidated, or fails to exit by the specified date, this part will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Hulu and Peacock announce a merger agreement by July 2024?

The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. question.title: Given that Hulu and Peacock announce a merger agreement by July 2024, will a major social media platform be reported for spreading election misinformation through its AI systems by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, Hulu and Peacock publicly announce a merger agreement. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from either company or reported by at least two major news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, Wall Street Journal, New York Times). The merger agreement should involve the combination of the two companies' operations or assets in some form. This question does not require the merger to be completed by the resolution date, only that an agreement is announced. If no such announcement is made by July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

Then, is the following true? By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given both a Hulu-Peacock merger announcement and social media AI election misinformation, will Virginia hold a privacy rights referendum by August 2024?

question.title: Will the White House announce conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the White House officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is the White House expected to declare the conversion of more vehicles to biofuel by July 2024?

question.title: Given the White House announces conversion of additional vehicles to biofuel by July 2024, will the Bank of England announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the White House officially announces that additional vehicles, beyond those already known, have been converted or are in the process of being converted to run on biofuel. The announcement must come from official White House channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the official fleet or directly associated with presidential transportation. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question will resolve as NO.

Then, is it true that the Bank of England will publicly announce a reduction in its key interest rate by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given both a White House biofuel announcement and a Bank of England rate cut, will the US maintain a 100% tariff on Japanese cars through August 2024?

The announcement must come from official White House channels or be reported by at least two major, reputable news outlets (such as BBC, Reuters, Associated Press, or The Guardian). The additional vehicles must be part of the official fleet or directly associated with presidential transportation. Also, by August 31, 2024, the Bank of England publicly announces a reduction in its key interest rate. The announcement must be officially made by the Bank of England and reported by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The reduction must be in the Bank Rate, which is the Bank of England's primary tool for influencing the economy. A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. Then, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Japanese-made automobiles through August 2024? This question resolves as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Japanese-made automobiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: In light of a biofuel declaration from the White House and a rate decrease by the Bank of England, will the United States uphold a 100% tariff on Japanese automobiles until August 2024?

If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question. para_P.title: Will the following three events take place: (a) The White House reveals plans to convert more vehicles to biofuel by July 2024, (b) The Bank of England announces a cut in its key interest rate by August 2024, and (c) The United States keeps a 100% tariff on Japanese-made cars until August 2024?

question.title: Will the reported death toll from the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceed 3 by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the number of reported deaths in the listeria outbreak linked to processed meats exceeds 3. The death toll must be confirmed by official health organizations such as the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) or other national health authorities. Alternatively, reports from at least three major reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times) citing official sources will be considered sufficient for confirmation. If the reported death toll remains at 3 or fewer by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Note that the outbreak must be specifically linked to processed meats, and deaths from other listeria outbreaks will not be considered for this question.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the number of deaths reported from the listeria outbreak associated with processed meats surpass 3?

para_P.title: If the number of confirmed fatalities from the listeria outbreak associated with processed meats surpasses 3 by August 2024, will the Reserve Bank of New Zealand introduce a fresh economic stimulus initiative by that date?

question.title: Given both a deadly listeria outbreak and a New Zealand economic stimulus, will a major oil spill occur in the North Sea by August 2024?
question.body:

2. The Central Bank of New Zealand announces a new economic stimulus package, confirmed by official communication and reported by at least two major financial news outlets.

Given these conditions, will there be a confirmed major oil spill in the North Sea by the same date, resulting from a tanker attack by an environmental activist group? A major oil spill is defined as one reported by at least two reputable international news sources and causing significant environmental damage, requiring large-scale cleanup efforts. The spill must be directly linked to an attack by an environmental activist group on a tanker in the North Sea.

question.title: Will South Korea become a member of the BRICS alliance by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, South Korea is formally accepted as a member of the BRICS alliance. For a positive resolution, the acceptance must be confirmed through official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). The formal acceptance must include South Korea as a full member, not just an observer or associate member. If no such acceptance occurs by the resolution date, or if South Korea's membership is still pending or under consideration, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is South Korea set to join the BRICS coalition by August 2024?

question.title: Given South Korea joins BRICS by August 2024, will Medicare's negotiated drug prices include insulin by August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, South Korea is formally accepted as a full member of the BRICS alliance, confirmed by official announcements from the BRICS alliance or any of its member countries (Brazil, Russia, India, China, South Africa) and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera). question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on public school funding by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying public school funding policies in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to public school funding. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Indiana regarding school funding before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, a public vote is held in Indiana specifically aimed at establishing or altering policies related to funding for public schools in the state. The vote must be officially organized by the state authorities, and its outcomes must be reported publicly by reliable news outlets or official state communications. In this context, a 'public vote' is defined as a direct decision made by the voters on a specific proposal, which in this instance pertains to the funding of public schools. The answer will be NO if such a vote does not take place or is not finalized by the given date, or if the vote is delayed beyond August 31, 2024.

question.title: Conditional on Indiana conducting a referendum on public school funding by August 2024, will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.8% by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying public school funding policies in the state. This referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. A 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal related to public school funding. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if it is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

Then, under this condition, the question is: Will the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, fall below 5.8% at any point by August 31, 2024? This rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. The rate must fall below 5.8% and a rate of exactly 5.8% will not count. If the rate does not fall below 5.8% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: If Indiana holds a public vote on school funding by August 2024, will the average 30-year mortgage rate in the US drop below 5.8% by that time?

The rate must drop below 5.8%, and a rate of exactly 5.8% will not be considered. If the rate does not decrease below 5.8% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac ceases to report this figure, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Given both a public school funding referendum in Indiana and a drop in 30-year mortgage rates below 5.8% by August 2024, will the US report a bumper harvest for corn and soybeans?

Given these conditions, will the United States officially report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, defined as yields at least 10% higher than the five-year average, confirmed by the USDA or three reputable news outlets?

para_P.title: If Indiana holds a public vote on school funding and 30-year mortgage rates drop below 5.8% by August 2024, will there be a significant corn and soybean harvest reported in the US?
para_P.body: Assuming the following occurs by August 31, 2024: (a) Indiana carries out a public vote aimed at establishing or changing public school funding policies, officially managed by the state and reported by reliable sources. (b) The average rate for a 30-year fixed mortgage in the US, as indicated by Freddie Mac, dips below 5.8% at any time. Under these circumstances, will the United States officially announce a significant harvest for both corn and soybeans, characterized as yields at least 10% above the five-year average, verified by the USDA or three credible news organizations?

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Indiana conducts a referendum on public school funding, (b) the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US falls below 5.8%, and (c) the United States reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024: (a) Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying public school funding policies in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. A 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to public school funding. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024. (b) The average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.8% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.8% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.8% will not be considered as falling below 5.8%. (c) The United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will the following three events take place: (a) Indiana holds a public vote regarding funding for schools, (b) the average interest rate for a 30-year mortgage in the US drops below 5.8%, and (c) the US announces a record harvest for both corn and soybeans?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if all of the subsequent conditions are satisfied by August 31, 2024: (a) Indiana carries out a public vote specifically aimed at establishing or changing funding policies for public education in the state. This vote must be officially organized by the state government, and the outcomes must be publicly disclosed by trustworthy news outlets or official state communications. A 'public vote' refers to a direct decision made by voters on a specific issue, in this case, concerning school funding. The inquiry will be answered with NO if such a vote does not take place or is not finalized by the designated date, or if the vote is delayed past August 31, 2024. (b) The mean rate on a 30-year fixed mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.8% at any time. This rate must be validated by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two credible financial news organizations such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not dip below 5.8% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac stops reporting this figure, the inquiry will be answered with NO. To clarify, a rate of exactly 5.8% will not be counted as being below 5.8%. (c) The United States officially announces a record harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating yields significantly above the average of the last five years. A record harvest is defined as a crop yield that is considerably higher than average, typically at least 10% more than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a record harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not for both, or if no record harvest is reported for either crop, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will IBM fund full tuition for all CMU computer science students by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that IBM's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the funding does not cover full tuition for all computer science students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will all CMU computer science students have their full tuition funded by IBM?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is officially verified that IBM's financial support is being utilized to pay for the complete tuition of every computer science student at Carnegie Mellon University, irrespective of their family income. If the funding does not extend to cover the full tuition for all computer science students by the specified resolution date, or if it only applies to a select group of students based on income or other criteria, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on IBM funding full tuition for all CMU computer science students by July 2024, will Minnesota implement a free community college plan by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, it is officially confirmed that IBM's funding is being used to cover full tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, regardless of their family income. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. If the funding does not cover full tuition for all computer science students by the resolution date, or if it only covers tuition for a subset of students based on income or other criteria, the condition is not met.

Given this condition is met, will Minnesota implement a free community college plan by July 31, 2024? This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Minnesota has officially implemented a free community college plan. Implementation is confirmed if students are able to enroll in community colleges without tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as local Minnesota newspapers, national news outlets, or official state government announcements). The plan must be part of a state-wide initiative, not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs. If no such implementation occurs by the resolution date, or if the implementation is only partial or limited, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If IBM fully funds tuition for every CMU computer science student by July 2024, will Minnesota roll out a free community college program by that same date?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: By July 31, 2024, it has been officially verified that IBM's funding is allocated to cover the entire tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, irrespective of their family's financial situation. This verification must come from official announcements from the university or reports from at least two credible news outlets. This inquiry will conclude with a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Minnesota has officially launched a free community college initiative. Confirmation of implementation occurs if students can enroll in community colleges without paying tuition fees, as reported by at least two reputable news sources (including local Minnesota newspapers, national news organizations, or official announcements from the state government). The initiative must be part of a statewide effort, not restricted to certain institutions or trial programs. If such an initiative is not implemented by the specified date, or if the implementation is only partial or restricted, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on both IBM funding full tuition for all CMU computer science students and Minnesota implementing a free community college plan by July 2024, will the ILO announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true by July 31, 2024: (a) IBM funds full tuition for all CMU computer science students, confirmed by official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources, covering all students regardless of income; and (b) Minnesota implements a state-wide free community college plan, confirmed by reports from at least two reputable news sources or official state announcements, allowing students to enroll without tuition fees and not limited to specific institutions or pilot programs.

Given these conditions, will the International Labour Organization officially announce new funding commitments totaling more than $400 million by July 31, 2024? The announcement(s) must be made through official ILO channels and reported by at least two reputable news sources. The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made or if the total does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Assuming that both IBM provides complete tuition coverage for every CMU computer science student and Minnesota launches a free community college initiative by July 2024, will the ILO declare new funding commitments exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Let’s consider the following scenario by July 31, 2024: (a) IBM covers full tuition for all CMU computer science students, verified by official university statements or reports from at least two trusted news outlets, applicable to all students irrespective of their financial background; and (b) Minnesota establishes a statewide free community college program, validated by reports from at least two credible news organizations or official state communications, enabling students to enroll without tuition costs and not restricted to particular institutions or pilot projects.

Under these circumstances, will the International Labour Organization formally announce new funding commitments amounting to more than $400 million by July 31, 2024? The announcements must occur through official ILO channels and be reported by at least two reputable media sources. The funding commitments should represent new initiatives or significant expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously disclosed commitments. If such an announcement is not made, or if the total does not surpass $400 million, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by July 2024: (a) IBM funds full tuition for all CMU computer science students, (b) Minnesota implements a free community college plan, and (c) the International Labour Organization announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million?
question.body:
(a) IBM funds full tuition for all CMU computer science students: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is confirmed that IBM's funding covers full tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, as per official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The funding must cover all students regardless of income.

(b) Minnesota implements a free community college plan: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Minnesota has implemented a state-wide free community college plan, confirmed by reports from at least two reputable news sources or official state announcements. Students must be able to enroll without tuition fees, and the plan should not be limited to specific institutions or pilot programs.

(c) The International Labour Organization announces new funding commitments totaling over $400 million: This resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Labour Organization officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official ILO channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

para_P.title: Will all of the following take place by July 2024: (a) IBM covers full tuition for every CMU computer science student, (b) Minnesota introduces a plan for free community college, and (c) the International Labour Organization reveals new funding pledges exceeding $400 million?
para_P.body:
(a) IBM covers full tuition for every CMU computer science student: This will be considered a YES if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that IBM's financial support includes full tuition for all computer science students at Carnegie Mellon University, based on official announcements from the university or reports from at least two credible news outlets. The funding must apply to all students, independent of their financial background.

(b) Minnesota introduces a plan for free community college: This will be considered a YES if, by July 31, 2024, Minnesota has launched a state-wide initiative for free community college, confirmed by reports from at least two credible news outlets or official announcements from the state. Students must be able to enroll without incurring tuition costs, and the initiative should not be restricted to certain institutions or pilot programs.

(c) The International Labour Organization reveals new funding pledges exceeding $400 million: This will be considered a YES if, by July 31, 2024, the International Labour Organization formally announces one or more new funding pledges that together exceed $400 million. The announcements must be made through official ILO channels (such as their website or press releases) and reported by at least two credible news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges must represent new initiatives or significant expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously made commitments.

question.title: Will Medicare's negotiated drug prices be reduced by more than 10% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as mentioned in the Biden administration's announcement, result in a reduction of more than 10% by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The reduction must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the reduction is not more than 10% by this date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the prices for drugs negotiated by Medicare fall by over 10% before August 2024?

The decrease must be confirmed by a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the decrease does not exceed 10% by this deadline, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on Medicare's negotiated drug prices being reduced by more than 10% by August 2024, will Tencent Holdings resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Medicare's newly negotiated drug prices result in a reduction of more than 10% by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official announcements from Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency, and reported by at least two reputable news sources.

Given this condition, will Tencent Holdings reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Tencent Holdings and the involved union, and reported by at least two reputable international news sources.

If the condition is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: If Medicare's newly negotiated drug prices drop by over 10% by August 2024, will Tencent Holdings settle a significant workers' strike by July 2024?

Assuming the following holds true: Medicare's recently negotiated drug prices lead to a decrease exceeding 10% by August 31, 2024, as validated by official announcements from Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another pertinent U.S. government agency, and reported by a minimum of two credible news outlets.

If the premise is not satisfied, the question will be considered N/A.

question.title: Given both Medicare's drug prices are reduced by more than 10% by August 2024 and Tencent resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, will the U.S. maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese batteries through August 2024?
question.body: Suppose the following is true: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices are reduced by more than 10% by August 31, 2024, confirmed by official announcements and reported by at least two reputable news sources; and (b) Tencent Holdings resolves a major workers' strike involving at least 1,000 workers by July 31, 2024, confirmed by official statements and reported by at least two reputable news sources. Given these conditions are met, will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made batteries through August 31, 2024? The tariff's existence must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations. If the tariff is reduced below 100% or removed by August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution.

para_P.title: If both Medicare's prescription drug prices decrease by over 10% by August 2024 and Tencent settles a significant labor strike by July 2024, will the U.S. continue to impose a 100% tariff on Chinese batteries until August 2024?
para_P.body: Assuming the following conditions hold: (a) Medicare's negotiated prices for drugs are lowered by more than 10% by August 31, 2024, as confirmed by official announcements and reported by at least two credible news outlets; and (b) Tencent Holdings successfully resolves a significant labor strike involving a minimum of 1,000 workers by July 31, 2024, as confirmed by official statements and reported by at least two reputable news organizations. Given these conditions are satisfied, will the United States uphold a 100% tariff on the importation of batteries manufactured in China through August 31, 2024? The existence of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources and corroborated by at least two respected news organizations. Should the tariff be reduced to below 100% or eliminated by August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers that do not result in a permanent change to the 100% rate will not influence the outcome.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by their respective deadlines: (a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices be reduced by more than 10%, (b) Tencent Holdings resolve a major workers' strike, AND (c) the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made batteries?
question.body:
(a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices must be reduced by more than 10% by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official announcements by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another relevant U.S. government agency. The reduction must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the reduction is not more than 10% by this date, the question resolves as NO.

(b) Tencent Holdings must reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. The strike must involve at least 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Tencent Holdings and the involved union, reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

(c) The United States must continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made batteries as of August 31, 2024. The tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

This question will resolve as YES only if all of the above conditions (a, b, and c) are met by their respective deadlines.

para_P.title: Is it guaranteed that the following will take place by their specified deadlines: (a) a reduction of over 10% in Medicare's negotiated drug prices, (b) Tencent Holdings settling a significant workers' strike, AND (c) the United States upholding a 100% tariff on batteries manufactured in China?
para_P.body:
(a) Medicare's negotiated drug prices are required to decrease by more than 10% by August 31, 2024. This must be validated by official announcements from Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another pertinent U.S. government entity. The reduction should be reported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the decrease is not greater than 10% by this deadline, the outcome will be NO.

(b) Tencent Holdings needs to come to a consensus with unionized workers, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. This strike must involve a minimum of 1,000 participants, last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed through official statements from both Tencent Holdings and the relevant union, reported by at least two trustworthy international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If such a resolution that meets all these criteria is not reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the outcome will be NO.

(c) The United States must persist in enforcing a 100% tariff on imports of batteries made in China as of August 31, 2024. The tariff rate must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and confirmed by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is lowered below 100% or entirely eliminated at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

This question will resolve as YES only if all of the aforementioned conditions (a, b, and c) are fulfilled by their respective deadlines.

question.title: Will California hold a referendum on gun control laws by July 2024?

question.title: Will North Carolina's abortion law allowing procedures up to 20 weeks remain unchanged by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, North Carolina's current abortion law permitting abortions up to 20 weeks remains in effect without any changes. If the law is modified, replaced, or overturned by the specified date, the question resolves as NO. This includes any changes that either restrict or expand the current 20-week limit.

para_P.title: Will the abortion legislation in North Carolina that permits procedures up to 20 weeks stay the same until August 2024?

question.title: Conditional on North Carolina's abortion law remaining unchanged, will Brazil close its investigation into Merck's diabetes drug pricing by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: North Carolina's abortion law allowing procedures up to 20 weeks remains unchanged by August 2024.
