question.title: Will X's AI chatbot Grok be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Grok and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will X's AI chatbot Grok face allegations of disseminating false information regarding elections by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there exist credible allegations or formal notices from election officials, governmental bodies, or trusted news agencies indicating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (previously known as Twitter) is disseminating false information about elections. For this inquiry, 'false election information' pertains to inaccurate or deceptive details concerning electoral processes, candidates, or outcomes. Credible allegations must originate from at least two of the following entities: state or federal election officials, prominent news organizations (like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US television networks), or peer-reviewed research published in respected journals. The allegations or notices must explicitly reference Grok and its involvement in spreading false election information. If no such allegations or notices are made by the resolution date, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.body: This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by their respective deadlines in 2024: (a) By August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that the AI chatbot Grok on the social media platform X (formerly known as Twitter) is spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention Grok and its role in spreading election misinformation. If no such reports or warnings are issued by the resolution date, this condition will resolve as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the U.S. Transportation Department's rule requiring airlines to more clearly disclose fees for baggage and ticket changes is officially in effect and being enforced. The implementation must be confirmed by official announcements from the U.S. Transportation Department or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, The New York Times, or The Wall Street Journal). If the rule remains blocked, is overturned, or is not implemented and enforced by the resolution date, this condition resolves as NO. Note that mere announcement of the rule without it being in effect does not qualify for a YES resolution. (c) By August 31, 2024, Carles Puigdemont, the former leader of Catalonia, is officially put on trial in Spain for his involvement in organizing the 2017 Catalan independence referendum. The trial must be formally initiated in a Spanish court, with Puigdemont physically present or represented by legal counsel. For the purpose of this question, 'trial' refers to the commencement of legal proceedings in a court of law, not merely an indictment or charges being filed. The charges must be directly related to Puigdemont's role in the 2017 referendum, which was declared illegal by Spanish authorities. If no such trial begins by the specified date, or if Puigdemont is granted immunity or amnesty that prevents a trial from occurring, the question will resolve as NO. The overall question will resolve as YES only if all conditions (a), (b), and (c) resolve as YES.

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official ECB communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by ECB officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the main refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's primary tool for monetary policy.

The interest rate in question pertains to the primary refinancing operations rate, which is the ECB's main tool for conducting monetary policy.

question.title: Will the FCA announce completion of a major financial fraud investigation by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into financial fraud involving at least five major financial institutions. Completion must be confirmed through an official FCA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times). If the FCA does not announce the completion of such an investigation by this date, or if the investigation is still ongoing, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Given the FCA announces completion of a major financial fraud investigation by July 2024, will the average rate on a 30-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.9% by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, the Financial Conduct Authority (FCA) of the UK officially announces the completion of its investigation into financial fraud involving at least five major financial institutions. This completion must be confirmed through an official FCA announcement or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, or New York Times).

Then, is the following also true? By August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.9% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. Note that a rate of exactly 5.9% will not be considered as falling below 5.9%.

para_P.title: If the FCA declares the conclusion of a significant financial fraud investigation by July 2024, will the typical rate for a 30-year mortgage in the United States drop below 5.9% by August 2024?

question.title: Given both the FCA completes a major financial fraud investigation and US mortgage rates fall below 5.9%, will Dean & DeLuca emerge from bankruptcy by July 2024?

The emergence must be confirmed by at least two reputable financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, or CNBC) or through official company statements or court documents, involving a court-approved reorganization plan that allows Dean & DeLuca to continue operations with a restructured financial position. question.title: Will a member of the U.S. Supreme Court use an AI-generated voice clone for a public address by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a member of the U.S. Supreme Court is confirmed to have used an AI-generated voice clone during a public address. The use of the AI-generated voice clone must be publicly acknowledged by the Justice or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The AI-generated voice clone must be used to deliver a substantial portion of the address, not just a brief demonstration. If no such use occurs by the resolution date, or if the use of an AI-generated voice clone is not confirmed by the specified sources, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will any U.S. Supreme Court Justice utilize a voice clone created by AI for a public speech?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, it is verified that a U.S. Supreme Court Justice has employed an AI-generated voice clone in a public speech. The AI-generated voice clone must be utilized to present a significant part of the speech, rather than just for a short demonstration. If such usage does not take place by the resolution date, or if the employment of an AI-generated voice clone is not confirmed by the designated sources, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: If a U.S. Supreme Court Justice uses an AI-generated voice clone for a public address, will Microsoft resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By July 31, 2024, a member of the U.S. Supreme Court is confirmed to have used an AI-generated voice clone during a public address. The use of the AI-generated voice clone must be publicly acknowledged by the Justice or reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, or CNN). The AI-generated voice clone must be used to deliver a substantial portion of the address, not just a brief demonstration.

Given this condition, will Microsoft reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Microsoft workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Microsoft and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

If the condition about the AI-generated voice clone is not met, the question resolves as N/A.

para_P.title: Should a Justice of the U.S. Supreme Court utilize a voice clone created by AI for a public speech, will Microsoft come to an agreement to end a major workers' strike by July 2024?

The AI-generated voice clone must be utilized to convey a significant portion of the speech, rather than just a short example.

Under this premise, will Microsoft finalize a deal with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a notable strike by July 31, 2024? For the resolution to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must include a considerable number of Microsoft employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must persist for a minimum of one week.
3. The agreement must be verified by official announcements from both Microsoft and the relevant union.
4. The agreement must be reported by at least two trustworthy international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such agreement that fulfills all these requirements is reached by the given date, or if no significant strike takes place, the question will resolve as NO.

If the stipulation regarding the AI-generated voice clone is not satisfied, the question will resolve as N/A.

question.title: Given both a U.S. Supreme Court Justice uses an AI-generated voice clone for a public address and Microsoft resolves a major workers' strike by July 2024, will California hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California, with the primary focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights, and results reported by official channels or recognized news sources.

question.title: Will the headquarters of a major cybersecurity company be fully relocated to Austin, Texas by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters from its original location to Austin, Texas. For the resolution to be affirmative:

1. The relocation must be officially announced by the company or its leadership.
2. The announcement must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
3. The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.

Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If the move is not completed and operational by this date, or if the company decides against the move, the question resolves as NO.

3. The new headquarters must be functioning in Austin, Texas, with essential executive operations transferred.

Any partial moves or plans that are still underway by July 31, 2024, will not qualify for a YES resolution. If the relocation is not finalized and operational by this date, or if the firm opts against the relocation, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Conditional on both a major cybersecurity company relocating to Austin and the Bank of England announcing new quantitative easing, will the Central Bank of Russia's preferred inflation measure show a monthly increase exceeding 0.5% by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true:

1. By July 31, 2024, a major cybersecurity company has fully relocated its headquarters to Austin, Texas. This includes:
   - An official announcement by the company or its leadership.
   - Reporting by at least two major, reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, Wall Street Journal, New York Times).
   - The new headquarters must be operational in Austin, Texas, with key executive functions transferred.
   - Partial relocations or plans still in progress by July 31, 2024, will not be sufficient.

2. By August 31, 2024, the Bank of England officially announces a new quantitative easing program. This requires:
   - An official announcement from a Bank of England communication channel (e.g., press release, monetary policy statement, public speech by the Governor).

question.title: Given Medicare's negotiated drug prices are reduced by more than 10% by August 2024, will U.S. job growth fall below 200,000 in any single month by July 2024?

If the tariff is lowered below 100% or completely lifted at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, this condition will be resolved as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the resolution of this condition. (3) The newly negotiated drug prices for Medicare, as outlined in the Biden administration's announcement, lead to a decrease of more than 10% by August 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official declarations by Medicare, the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services, or another pertinent U.S. government agency. The reduction must be reported by at least two trustworthy news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). If the reduction does not exceed 10% by this date, the question will resolve as NO. The final resolution of this combined inquiry is YES only if all criteria are met.

question.title: Will Massachusetts conduct a referendum on digital privacy laws by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Massachusetts conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying digital privacy laws in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to digital privacy laws. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the Central Bank of Singapore announce a new exchange rate policy by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore officially announces a new exchange rate policy. The announcement must come from an official Central Bank of Singapore communication channel, such as a press release or a public speech by the Governor of the Central Bank of Singapore. The announcement should explicitly describe the new exchange rate policy. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore maintains the current exchange rate policy, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the Central Bank of Singapore will introduce a revised exchange rate policy before the end of August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed TRUE if, by August 31, 2024, the Central Bank of Singapore publicly declares a revised exchange rate policy. If no such declaration occurs by the given date, or if the Central Bank of Singapore chooses to keep the existing exchange rate policy, the inquiry will resolve as FALSE.

question.title: Conditional on the Central Bank of Singapore announcing a new exchange rate policy by August 2024, will Australia eliminate export taxes on agricultural products by July 2024?
question.body:

Given this, will Australia eliminate export taxes on all agricultural products by July 31, 2024? For Australia to have eliminated these taxes, the Australian government must officially announce the complete elimination of export taxes on all agricultural products, confirmed by official government statements or reported by at least two reputable international news sources such as Reuters or Bloomberg. Partial reductions or eliminations for specific products will not be sufficient for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If the Central Bank of Singapore declares a new exchange rate policy by August 2024, will Australia remove export duties on agricultural goods by July 2024?

question.title: Will Amazon announce the layoff of at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Amazon has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Amazon confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

question.title: Will Oregon conduct a referendum on environmental protection laws by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying environmental protection laws in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. For the purpose of this question, a 'referendum' refers to a direct vote by the electorate on a particular proposal, in this case, related to environmental protection laws. The question will resolve as NO if no such referendum occurs or is completed by the specified date, or if the referendum is postponed beyond August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Is Oregon going to hold a public vote on environmental protection legislation before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered affirmatively if, by August 31, 2024, Oregon holds a public vote specifically aimed at establishing or altering environmental protection legislation within the state. The vote must be officially organized by the state authorities and its outcomes must be disclosed by reliable news outlets or official state communication channels. For the purposes of this inquiry, a 'public vote' refers to a direct decision made by the voters on a specific proposal, in this instance, concerning environmental protection legislation. This inquiry will be answered negatively if no such public vote takes place or is finalized by the given date, or if the vote is delayed beyond August 31, 2024.

question.title: Given Oregon conducts a referendum on environmental protection laws by August 2024, will Indiana hold a referendum on tax reform by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, Oregon conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting or modifying environmental protection laws in the state. The referendum must be officially conducted by the state government and its results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels.

Then, will Indiana conduct an official public referendum specifically focused on tax reform in the state by the same date? The following criteria must be met for a YES resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on tax reform.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If Oregon holds a public vote on environmental protection laws before August 2024, will Indiana also hold a public vote on tax reform by that same date?

In that case, will Indiana organize an official public vote concentrating on tax reform within the state by the same deadline? The following conditions must be satisfied for a YES outcome:

1. The vote must be formally declared and executed by the state of Indiana.
2. The main emphasis of the vote must be on tax reform.
3. The outcomes of the vote must be communicated by official state channels or well-known news organizations.

If no such vote takes place or is finalized by August 31, 2024, the question will be answered with NO. Proposed votes that have not been officially executed by the resolution date do not qualify for a YES outcome.

Each referendum must be officially conducted by the respective state government and results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. Then, will the USDA have distributed more than $2 billion in federal aid specifically to urban farmers by the same date? The distribution must be confirmed by official USDA reports or statements and reported by at least two reputable news sources, and must be specifically targeted at urban farmers. If the total distributed amount is less than or equal to $2 billion, or if the distribution is not specifically targeted at urban farmers, the question resolves as NO.

The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. question.title: GIVEN the Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation announces over $400 million in new funding by July 2024, will the Central Bank of Brazil announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?

The announcement(s) must be made through official Gates Foundation channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments.

Given this, will the Central Bank of Brazil officially announce an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be confirmed by official Central Bank of Brazil communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the Selic rate, which is the Central Bank of Brazil's primary tool for monetary policy.

It is important to note that the actual date of implementation for the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the Selic rate, which serves as the primary monetary policy instrument of the Central Bank of Brazil.

question.title: Will Texas's 6-week abortion ban be overturned by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Texas's law banning most abortions after approximately six weeks of pregnancy is either repealed by the state legislature or invalidated by a court ruling. The repeal or invalidation must be confirmed by official state announcements or reported by at least two reputable news sources. If the law remains in effect as of July 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'overturned' means the law is no longer enforceable in its current form, either through legislative action or judicial decision.

para_P.title: Will the 6-week abortion restriction in Texas be nullified by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered YES if, by July 31, 2024, the legislation in Texas that prohibits most abortions after about six weeks of gestation is either rescinded by the state legislature or deemed unconstitutional by a court. The rescission or ruling must be verified by official announcements from the state or reported by at least two credible news outlets. If the legislation is still in effect as of July 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. In this context, 'nullified' indicates that the law is no longer applicable in its present form, either through legislative measures or judicial rulings.

question.title: Conditional on Texas's 6-week abortion ban being overturned by July 2024, will Edward Snowden be extradited to the United States by August 2024?
question.body:

Then, is it true that by August 31, 2024, Edward Snowden will be extradited from Russia to the United States to face legal proceedings? The extradition must be confirmed through official court documents or statements from legal authorities and reported by at least two reputable news sources. If Snowden remains in Russian custody without being extradited by the resolution date, or if he is released from custody entirely, the question resolves as NO.

If Snowden is still held in Russia without being extradited by the specified date, or if he is entirely released from custody, the answer will be NO.

Scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If Texas's six-week abortion prohibition is annulled by July 2024 and Edward Snowden is sent back to the U.S. by August 2024, will there be a statewide vote in South Carolina regarding abortion rights by July 2024?

question.title: Will the DAX Index lose over €3 trillion in value by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, reputable financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal) report that the total value lost by the DAX Index has exceeded €3 trillion since October 1, 2023. The loss in value should be calculated from the index's peak value prior to October 1, 2023. If the total value lost remains at or below €3 trillion by the resolution date, or if there are no clear reports confirming such a loss, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, the value lost refers to the decrease in the combined market capitalization of the companies comprising the DAX Index.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Germany and India implement a new form of cooperation, (b) Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin, and (c) Fresh Valley Produce be officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak?

(a) By July 31, 2024, Germany and India have publicly announced the implementation of a new form of cooperation as part of a bilateral action plan. The announcement must be confirmed by official statements from either the German or Indian government and reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or major national news agencies of either country). This could include, but is not limited to, joint ventures in emerging technologies, novel trade agreements, or innovative cultural exchange programs. (b) By August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this part resolves as NO.

(c) By July 31, 2024, Fresh Valley Produce is officially linked to a new salmonella outbreak that is different from any previously reported outbreaks. The link must be confirmed by U.S. federal health officials (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Fresh Valley Produce and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If such an agreement is not confirmed by the resolution deadline, this segment will be marked as NO.

(b) By August 31, 2024, the Federation Council of Russia enacts a major economic reform bill that is clearly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:
1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, encompassing areas such as fiscal expenditure, taxation, or monetary regulation.
2. It must be approved by the Federation Council, irrespective of whether it is enacted into law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be distinctly reported by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential repercussions on the Russian economy.

If no such legislation is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but fails to fulfill all the aforementioned criteria, this part will resolve as NO.

(c) By July 31, 2024, Fresh Valley Produce is officially connected to a newly identified salmonella outbreak that is distinct from any previously documented outbreaks. This connection must be corroborated by U.S. federal health authorities (such as the CDC or FDA) and reported by at least two trustworthy news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post). The outbreak must be traced back to products from Fresh Valley Produce and must have occurred after October 1, 2023. If no such new outbreak is linked to Fresh Valley Produce by the resolution date, the inquiry resolves as NO.

The overall inquiry will be affirmed as YES only if all three conditions (a), (b), and (c) are met.

question.title: Will the Bank of Canada announce an increase in interest rates by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bank of Canada officially announces an increase in interest rates. The announcement must come from an official Bank of Canada communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the Governor of the Bank of Canada. The announcement should explicitly state the intention to raise the interest rate from its current level. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Bank of Canada maintains or lowers interest rates, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the Bank of Canada will declare an increase in interest rates before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be marked as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bank of Canada makes an official declaration regarding an increase in interest rates. The declaration must originate from a recognized communication channel of the Bank of Canada, such as a press release, a monetary policy statement, or a public address by the Governor of the Bank of Canada. The declaration should clearly indicate the plan to elevate the interest rate from its present level. Additionally, the declaration must be covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such declaration occurs by the specified date, or if the Bank of Canada keeps or reduces interest rates, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: If the Bank of Canada announces an interest rate increase by August 2024, will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: By August 31, 2024, the Bank of Canada officially announces an increase in interest rates, with the announcement reported by at least two major financial news outlets. Then, will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 31, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition (P): The Bank of Canada must announce an interest rate increase through an official channel, with the announcement reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters). If no such announcement is made, the condition is not met.

Resolution criteria for the outcome (Q): The WHO must publicly announce that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency, with the announcement reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, BBC). The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak. If no such declaration is made, or if the emergency status is maintained or escalated, the outcome resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Should the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria to be no longer a global emergency by August 2024 if the Bank of Canada announces an interest rate hike by that time?
para_P.body:
Imagine that by August 31, 2024, the Bank of Canada has officially declared an increase in interest rates, with this announcement being covered by at least two prominent financial news organizations. In that case, will the WHO state that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency by August 31, 2024?

Criteria for the condition (P): The Bank of Canada must make an official announcement regarding an interest rate increase, and this must be reported by a minimum of two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg or Reuters). If such an announcement does not occur, the condition is not satisfied.

Criteria for the outcome (Q): The WHO needs to publicly declare that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency, with this declaration being reported by at least two major international news agencies (for instance, Reuters or BBC). The announcement must specifically mention the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak. If no such announcement is made, or if the emergency status remains the same or worsens, the outcome will be NO.

question.title: Conditional on both a Bank of Canada interest rate increase and WHO declaring the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024, will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following two conditions are true by August 31, 2024:

1. The Bank of Canada officially announces an increase in interest rates. This announcement must come from an official Bank of Canada communication channel and be reported by at least two major financial news outlets.

2. The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets and specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Given these conditions, will the Reserve Bank of India officially announce an interest rate cut by August 31, 2024? The announcement must be through official RBI communications and concern the repo rate, with confirmation from at least two major financial news outlets. The actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date.

para_P.title: Assuming both the Bank of Canada raises interest rates and the WHO states that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency by August 2024, will the Reserve Bank of India declare an interest rate reduction by August 2024?
para_P.body:
Let us consider that by August 31, 2024, the following two scenarios hold true:

1. The Bank of Canada publicly announces a hike in interest rates. This announcement must originate from an official communication channel of the Bank of Canada and be covered by at least two significant financial news organizations.

2. The World Health Organization (WHO) publicly announces that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer regarded as a global emergency. This statement must be reported by at least two prominent international news agencies and must specifically mention the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria.

Given these scenarios, will the Reserve Bank of India make an official statement regarding an interest rate cut by August 31, 2024? The announcement must come through official communications from the RBI and pertain to the repo rate, with confirmation from no fewer than two major financial news outlets. The actual date for implementing the rate cut may be after August 31, 2024, provided that the announcement itself is made by that date.

question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) The Bank of Canada announces an increase in interest rates, (b) The WHO declares the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency, and (c) The Reserve Bank of India announces an interest rate cut?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if all of the following conditions are met by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Bank of Canada officially announces an increase in interest rates. The announcement must come from an official Bank of Canada communication channel, such as a press release, monetary policy statement, or a public speech by the Governor of the Bank of Canada. The announcement should explicitly state the intention to raise the interest rate from its current level. The announcement must be reported by at least two major financial news outlets (e.g., Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be considered valid. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the Bank of Canada maintains or lowers interest rates, this condition is not met.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN). The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general. If the WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024, or if the WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak, or if the WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, this condition is not met.

(c) The Reserve Bank of India officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official RBI communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by RBI officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary tool for monetary policy.

The question resolves as NO if any of these conditions are not met by the specified date.

para_P.title: Is it certain that by August 2024, the following will happen: (a) The Bank of Canada will announce a rise in interest rates, (b) The WHO will state that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency, and (c) The Reserve Bank of India will declare a reduction in interest rates?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with a YES if all of the subsequent criteria are fulfilled by August 31, 2024:

(a) The Bank of Canada must officially declare an increase in interest rates. This declaration should be issued through an authorized Bank of Canada communication channel, such as a press release, a monetary policy statement, or a public address by the Governor of the Bank of Canada. The statement should clearly indicate the plan to elevate the interest rate from its existing level. The announcement needs to be covered by at least two significant financial news organizations (for instance, Bloomberg, Reuters, Wall Street Journal, CNBC, Financial Times) to be deemed valid. If no such declaration is made by the designated date, or if the Bank of Canada keeps or reduces interest rates, this criterion is not satisfied.

(b) The World Health Organization (WHO) must officially announce that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer regarded as a global emergency. The WHO is required to make a public statement explicitly declaring that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. This announcement should be reported by at least two major international news agencies (like Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN). The declaration must specifically mention the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, rather than a general global Lassa fever scenario. If the WHO fails to issue such a declaration by August 31, 2024, or if the WHO makes a statement about Lassa fever that does not specifically mention the Nigerian outbreak, or if the WHO maintains or intensifies the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, this criterion is not fulfilled.

(c) The Reserve Bank of India must officially announce a reduction in interest rates to take effect by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be verified by official RBI communications, such as press releases, Monetary Policy Committee statements, or public speeches by RBI officials. If no such announcement occurs by the resolution date, the answer will be NO. It is important to note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself is made by that date. The interest rate in question pertains to the repo rate, which is the RBI's primary monetary policy instrument.

The question will be answered with a NO if any of these criteria are not met by the specified date.

question.title: Will Tennessee enact new abortion regulations stricter than those for other healthcare providers by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Tennessee enacts new laws or regulations that impose stricter requirements on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers. The enactment must be confirmed by official state legislative documentation or reported by at least two reputable news sources. Stricter requirements may include, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility standards specific to abortion providers. If no such laws or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any enacted laws or regulations apply equally to all healthcare providers, the question will resolve as NO.

More stringent standards may encompass, but are not limited to, additional licensing, reporting, or facility requirements specifically for abortion providers. If no such legislation or regulations are enacted by the resolution date, or if any laws or regulations that are enacted apply uniformly to all medical providers, the inquiry will be considered FALSE.

question.title: Given Tennessee enacts stricter abortion regulations by July 2024, will California hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?

Then, will California conduct an official public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state by August 31, 2024? For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of California.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum occurs or is completed by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Proposed referendums that have not been officially conducted by the resolution date do not count for a YES resolution.

para_P.title: If Tennessee implements more stringent abortion laws by July 2024, will California hold a vote on abortion rights by August 2024?

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a time-limited coverage by July 2024?
