question.title: Will all of the following occur by August 2024: (a) Amazon announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 5% (b) Rogers Communications publicly confirm a payment to a hacker to erase sensitive data (c) Italy's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by Prime Minister Meloni?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if all of the following occur:

(a) Amazon officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 5% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 5% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if Amazon only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 5% reduction without announcing new cuts, this part will resolve as NO.

(b) Rogers Communications publicly confirms through an official statement or press release that they made a payment to a hacker to erase sensitive data by July 31, 2024. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). The payment must be specifically for erasing sensitive data, not for other purposes. If no such confirmation is made by Rogers Communications or if Rogers Communications denies making such a payment, this part will resolve as NO. Note that this question does not consider unofficial statements, leaks, or speculations as valid confirmations.

(c) Italy's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni or her administration by August 31, 2024. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy, and must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law. The opposition from Prime Minister Meloni or her administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times). The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Italian economy. If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, this part will resolve as NO.

The combined question will resolve as YES only if all three parts (a), (b), and (c) resolve as YES.

(2) Additionally, Florida must pass a new law that modifies or replaces the existing restrictions on medical care for transgender youth. question.title: Will Georgia conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Georgia conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Georgia.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Conditional on U.S. weekly jobless claims exceeding 250,000 for three consecutive weeks by August 2024, will Ohio maintain its $11 per hour minimum wage for fast food workers through July 2024?

The question resolves as NO if the wage is reduced below $11 per hour at any point by the resolution date. 'Fast food workers' refers to employees in fast food restaurants as defined by Ohio state law. If the condition about jobless claims is not met, the question resolves N/A.

para_P.title: Will there be more layoffs from SpaceX beyond the initially disclosed 8% by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if SpaceX makes a formal announcement regarding further layoffs exceeding the initially disclosed 8% of its staff by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official communications from the company or reports from at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be distinctly separate from the previously reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are declared by the deadline, or if SpaceX only shares updates or clarifications concerning the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing any new layoffs, the inquiry will be considered NO.

question.title: Conditional on SpaceX announcing additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024, will MIT fully cover tuition for computer science students from lower-income families by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: SpaceX officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if SpaceX only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, the question will resolve as NO.

Then, is it true that the Massachusetts Institute of Technology will fully cover tuition for computer science students from families earning less than $100,000 annually by July 31, 2024? This question will resolve as YES if, by the specified date, MIT officially implements such a policy, confirmed by official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: If SpaceX declares further layoffs exceeding the initially stated 8% by August 2024, will MIT provide full tuition coverage for computer science students from low-income households by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: SpaceX makes an official announcement regarding additional layoffs that go beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be validated through official statements from the company or reports from at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The new layoffs need to be distinctly separate from the originally reported 8% workforce reduction. If no further layoffs are announced by the specified deadline, or if SpaceX merely offers updates or clarifications about the previously reported 8% reduction without announcing new layoffs, the question will be considered as NO.

Then, is it accurate to say that the Massachusetts Institute of Technology will provide full tuition funding for computer science students from families with an annual income below $100,000 by July 31, 2024? This question will be deemed as YES if, by the specified date, MIT officially adopts such a policy, confirmed by official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news outlets (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or sooner. If such a policy is not confirmed by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage specifics vary significantly from what has been outlined, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Given both SpaceX announces additional layoffs and MIT covers tuition for lower-income CS students, will NASA announce a new simulated Mars environment with SpaceX by July 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following are true:

(a) SpaceX officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024, confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from the initially reported 8% workforce reduction.

(b) MIT officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for computer science students from families earning less than $100,000 annually by July 31, 2024, confirmed by official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources. The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier.

Then, will NASA announce a new type of simulated Mars environment in collaboration with SpaceX by July 31, 2024? The announcement must be official, distinct from any previously disclosed projects, and reported by at least three major news organizations.

para_P.title: If SpaceX reveals more job cuts and MIT provides tuition support for low-income CS students, will NASA reveal a new simulated Mars environment with SpaceX by July 2024?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following statements are accurate:

(a) SpaceX makes an official statement about additional job cuts exceeding the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024, as confirmed by official company communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets. These additional layoffs must be distinctly separate from the previously announced 8% workforce reduction.

(b) MIT puts into effect a policy to fully subsidize tuition for computer science students from families with annual incomes below $100,000 by July 31, 2024, verified by official announcements from the university or reports from at least two trustworthy news sources. This policy must be applicable for the 2024-2025 academic year or sooner.

Then, will NASA make an official announcement regarding a new kind of simulated Mars environment in partnership with SpaceX by July 31, 2024? This announcement must be official, separate from any previously announced projects, and reported by at least three prominent news organizations.

question.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) SpaceX announce additional layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% by August 2024, (b) MIT fully cover tuition for computer science students from lower-income families by July 2024, and (c) NASA announce a new type of simulated Mars environment in collaboration with SpaceX by July 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if all of the following conditions are met:

(a) SpaceX officially announces further layoffs beyond the initially reported 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official company statements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The additional layoffs must be clearly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are announced by the specified date, or if SpaceX only provides updates or clarifications about the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new cuts, this condition will resolve as NO.

(b) The Massachusetts Institute of Technology officially implements a policy to fully cover tuition for computer science students from families earning less than $100,000 annually by July 31, 2024. The confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news sources (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be in effect for the 2024-2025 academic year or earlier. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details differ significantly from those specified, this condition resolves as NO.

(c) By July 31, 2024, NASA officially announces the development or initiation of a new type of simulated Mars environment in collaboration with SpaceX that is distinct from any previously disclosed projects. The announcement must come from official NASA channels or be reported by at least three major news organizations. The new environment must be explicitly described as a separate project or initiative from existing simulations. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced project is merely an extension or modification of an existing simulation, the question will resolve as NO.

The overall question will resolve as YES only if all of the conditions (a), (b), and (c) resolve as YES.

para_P.title: Is it possible that the following events will take place: (a) SpaceX makes a further announcement of layoffs exceeding the initially reported 8% by August 2024, (b) MIT provides complete tuition coverage for computer science students from low-income families by July 2024, and (c) NASA reveals a new simulated Mars environment created in partnership with SpaceX by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as YES if all of these conditions are satisfied:

(a) SpaceX formally discloses additional layoffs that go beyond the initially indicated 8% of its workforce by August 31, 2024. This announcement must be verified through official company communications or reports from at least two credible news outlets (like Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The further layoffs must be distinctly separate from and in addition to the initially reported 8% workforce reduction. If no such additional layoffs are revealed by the specified date, or if SpaceX only offers updates or clarifications regarding the initially reported 8% reduction without announcing new layoffs, this condition will resolve as NO.

(b) The Massachusetts Institute of Technology officially establishes a policy to fully subsidize tuition for computer science students from families with annual incomes below $100,000 by July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official university announcements or reports from at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., The New York Times, Wall Street Journal, Reuters, Associated Press). The policy must be effective for the 2024-2025 academic year or sooner. If such a policy is not confirmed to be in place by the resolution date, or if the income threshold or coverage details significantly differ from those specified, this condition resolves as NO.

(c) By July 31, 2024, NASA officially announces the creation or launch of a new type of simulated Mars environment in collaboration with SpaceX that is different from any previously disclosed initiatives. This announcement must be made through official NASA channels or reported by at least three major news organizations. The new environment must be clearly identified as a separate project or initiative from existing simulations. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, or if the announced project is merely an extension or modification of an existing simulation, the question will resolve as NO.

The overall inquiry will resolve as YES only if all of the conditions (a), (b), and (c) resolve as YES.
